Theory Cyclic_Group_Ext

theory Cyclic_Group_Ext imports
  CryptHOL.CryptHOL
  "HOL-Number_Theory.Cong"
begin

context cyclic_group begin

lemma generator_pow_order: "â™g [^] order G = ğŸ­"
proof(cases "order G > 0")
  case True
  hence fin: "finite (carrier G)" by(simp add: order_gt_0_iff_finite)
  then have [symmetric]: "(Î»x. x âŠ— â™g) ` carrier G = carrier G"
    by(rule endo_inj_surj)(auto simp add: inj_on_multc)
  then have "carrier G = (Î» n. â™g [^] Suc n) ` {..<order G}" 
    using fin by(simp add: carrier_conv_generator image_image)
  then obtain n where n: "ğŸ­ = â™g [^] Suc n" "n < order G" by auto
  have "n = order G - 1" using n inj_onD[OF inj_on_generator, of 0 "Suc n"] by fastforce
  with True n show ?thesis by auto
qed simp
                        
lemma pow_generator_mod: "â™g [^] (k mod order G) = â™g [^] k"
proof(cases "order G > 0")
  case True
  obtain n where n: "k = n * order G + k mod order G" by (metis div_mult_mod_eq)
  have "â™g [^] k = (â™g [^] order G) [^] n âŠ— â™g [^] (k mod order G)" 
    by(subst n)(simp add: nat_pow_mult nat_pow_pow mult_ac)
  then show ?thesis by(simp add: generator_pow_order)
qed simp

lemma int_nat_pow: 
  assumes "a â‰¥ 0" 
  shows "(â™g [^] (int (a ::nat))) [^] (b::int)  = â™g [^] (a*b)"
  using assms 
proof(cases "a > 0")
  case True 
  show ?thesis
    using int_pow_pow by blast
next case False
  have "(â™g [^] (int (a ::nat))) [^] (b::int) = ğŸ­" using False by simp
  also have "â™g [^] (a*b) = ğŸ­" using False by simp
  ultimately show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma pow_generator_mod_int: "â™g [^] ((k :: int) mod order G) = â™g [^] k"
proof(cases "order G > 0")
  case True
  obtain n :: int where n: "k = order G * n + k mod order G" 
    by (metis div_mult_mod_eq mult.commute)
  then have "â™g [^] k = â™g [^] (order G * n) âŠ— â™g [^] (k mod order G)" 
    using int_pow_mult nat_pow_mult by (metis generator_closed)
  then have "â™g [^] k = (â™g [^] order G) [^] n âŠ— â™g [^] (k mod order G)"
    using int_nat_pow by (simp add: int_pow_int)
  then show ?thesis by(simp add: generator_pow_order)
qed simp

lemma pow_gen_mod_mult:
  shows"(â™g [^] (a::nat) âŠ— â™g [^] (b::nat)) [^] ((c::int)* int (d::nat)) = (â™g [^] a âŠ— â™g [^] b) [^] ((c*int d) mod (order G))"
proof-
  have "(â™g [^] (a::nat) âŠ— â™g [^] (b::nat)) âˆˆ carrier G" by simp
  then obtain n :: nat where n: "â™g [^] n = (â™g [^] (a::nat) âŠ— â™g [^] (b::nat))" 
    by (simp add: monoid.nat_pow_mult)
  also obtain r where r: "r = c*int d" by simp
  have "(â™g [^] (a::nat) âŠ— â™g [^] (b::nat)) [^] ((c::int)*int (d::nat)) = (â™g [^] n) [^] r" using n r by simp
  moreover have"... = (â™g [^] n) [^] (r mod (order G))" using pow_generator_mod_int pow_generator_mod 
    by (metis int_nat_pow int_pow_int mod_mult_right_eq zero_le)
  moreover have "... =  (â™g [^] a âŠ— â™g [^] b) [^] ((c*int d) mod (order G))" using r n by simp
  ultimately show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma pow_generator_eq_iff_cong:
  "finite (carrier G) âŸ¹ â™g [^] x = â™g [^] y âŸ· [x = y] (mod order G)"
  by(subst (1 2) pow_generator_mod[symmetric])(auto simp add: cong_def order_gt_0_iff_finite intro: inj_onD[OF inj_on_generator])

lemma cyclic_group_commute: 
  assumes "a âˆˆ carrier G" "b âˆˆ carrier G" 
  shows "a âŠ— b = b âŠ— a"
(is "?lhs = ?rhs")
proof-
  obtain n :: nat where n: "a = â™g [^] n" using generatorE assms by auto
  also  obtain k :: nat where k: "b = â™g [^] k" using generatorE assms by auto
  ultimately have "?lhs =  â™g [^] n âŠ— â™g [^] k" by simp
  then have "... = â™g [^] (n + k)" by(simp add: nat_pow_mult)
  then have "... = â™g [^] (k + n)" by(simp add: add.commute)
  then show ?thesis by(simp add: nat_pow_mult n k)
qed

lemma cyclic_group_assoc: 
  assumes "a âˆˆ carrier G" "b âˆˆ carrier G" "c âˆˆ carrier G"
  shows "(a âŠ— b) âŠ— c = a âŠ— (b âŠ— c)"
(is "?lhs = ?rhs")
proof-
  obtain n :: nat where n: "a = â™g [^] n" using generatorE assms by auto
  obtain k :: nat where k: "b = â™g [^] k" using generatorE assms by auto
  obtain j :: nat where j: "c = â™g [^] j" using generatorE assms by auto 
  have "?lhs = (â™g [^] n âŠ— â™g [^] k) âŠ— â™g [^] j" using n k j by simp
  then have "... = â™g [^] (n + (k + j))" by(simp add: nat_pow_mult add.assoc)
  then show ?thesis by(simp add: nat_pow_mult n k j)
qed
 
lemma l_cancel_inv: 
  assumes "h âˆˆ carrier G" 
  shows "(â™g [^] (a :: nat) âŠ— inv (â™g [^] a)) âŠ— h = h"
(is "?lhs = ?rhs")
proof-
  have "?lhs = (â™g [^] int a âŠ— inv (â™g [^] int a)) âŠ— h" by simp
  then have "... = (â™g [^] int a âŠ— (â™g [^] (- a))) âŠ— h" using int_pow_neg[symmetric] by simp
  then have "... = â™g [^] (int a - a)  âŠ— h" by(simp add: int_pow_mult)
  then have "... = â™g [^] ((0:: int)) âŠ— h" by simp
  then show ?thesis by (simp add: assms)
qed

lemma inverse_split: 
  assumes "a âˆˆ carrier G" and "b âˆˆ carrier G"
  shows "inv (a âŠ— b) = inv a âŠ— inv b"
  by (simp add:  assms comm_group.inv_mult cyclic_group_commute group_comm_groupI)

lemma inverse_pow_pow:
  assumes "a âˆˆ carrier G"
  shows "inv (a [^] (r::nat)) = (inv a) [^] r"
proof -
  have "a [^] r âˆˆ carrier G"
    using assms by blast
  then show ?thesis
    by (simp add: assms nat_pow_inv)
qed

lemma l_neq_1_exp_neq_0:
  assumes "l âˆˆ carrier G" 
    and "l â‰  ğŸ­" 
    and "l = â™g [^] (t::nat)" 
  shows "t â‰  0"
proof(rule ccontr)
  assume "Â¬ (t â‰  0)"
  hence "t = 0" by simp
  hence "â™g [^] t = ğŸ­" by simp
  then show "False" using assms by simp
qed

lemma order_gt_1_gen_not_1:
  assumes "order G > 1"
  shows "â™g â‰  ğŸ­"
proof(rule ccontr)
  assume "Â¬ â™g â‰  ğŸ­"
  hence "â™g = ğŸ­" by simp
  hence g_pow_eq_1: "â™g [^] n = ğŸ­" for n :: nat by simp
  hence "range (Î»n :: nat. â™g [^] n) = {ğŸ­}" by auto
  hence "carrier G âŠ† {ğŸ­}" using generator by auto
  hence "order G < 1" 
    by (metis One_nat_def assms g_pow_eq_1 inj_onD inj_on_generator lessThan_iff not_gr_zero zero_less_Suc)
  with assms show "False" by simp
qed

lemma power_swap: "((â™g [^] (Î±0::nat)) [^] (r::nat)) = ((â™g [^] r) [^] Î±0)"
(is "?lhs = ?rhs")
proof-
  have "?lhs = â™g [^] (Î±0 * r)" 
    using nat_pow_pow mult.commute by auto
  hence "... = â™g [^] (r * Î±0)" 
    by(metis mult.commute)
  thus ?thesis using nat_pow_pow by auto
qed

end 

end

Theory Number_Theory_Aux

theory Number_Theory_Aux imports
  "HOL-Number_Theory.Cong"
  "HOL-Number_Theory.Residues"
begin

lemma bezw_inverse:
  assumes "gcd (e :: nat) (N ::nat) = 1" 
  shows "[nat e * nat ((fst (bezw e N)) mod N) = 1] (mod nat N)"
proof-
  have "(fst (bezw e N) * e + snd (bezw e N) * N) mod N = 1 mod N"
    by (metis assms bezw_aux zmod_int)
  hence "(fst (bezw e N) mod N * e mod N) = 1 mod N" 
    by (simp add: mod_mult_right_eq mult.commute)
  hence cong_eq: "[(fst (bezw e N) mod N * e) = 1] (mod N)" 
    by (metis of_nat_1 zmod_int cong_def)
  hence "[nat (fst (bezw e N) mod N) * e = 1] (mod N)" 
  proof -
    { assume "int (nat (fst (bezw e N) mod int N)) â‰  fst (bezw e N) mod int N"
      have "N = 0 âŸ¶ 0 â‰¤ fst (bezw e N) mod int N"
        by fastforce
      then have "int (nat (fst (bezw e N) mod int N)) = fst (bezw e N) mod int N"
        by fastforce }
    then have "[int (nat (fst (bezw e N) mod int N) * e) = int 1] (mod int N)"
      by (metis cong_eq of_nat_1 of_nat_mult)
    then show ?thesis 
      using cong_int_iff by blast
  qed
  then show ?thesis by(simp add: mult.commute)
qed

lemma inverse: 
  assumes "gcd x (q::nat) = 1" 
    and "q > 0" 
  shows "[x * (fst (bezw x q)) = 1] (mod q)"
proof-
  have int_eq: "fst (bezw  x q) * x + snd (bezw x q) * int q = 1" 
    by (metis assms(1) bezw_aux of_nat_1)
  hence int_eq': "(fst (bezw  x q) * x + snd (bezw x q) * int q) mod q = 1 mod q" 
    by (metis of_nat_1 zmod_int)
  hence "(fst (bezw x q) * x) mod q = 1 mod q"
    by simp 
  hence "[(fst (bezw x q)) * x  = 1] (mod q)" 
    using cong_def int_eq int_eq' by metis
  then show ?thesis by(simp add: mult.commute) 
qed

lemma prod_not_prime: 
  assumes "prime (x::nat)" 
    and "prime y" 
    and "x > 2" 
    and "y > 2" 
  shows "Â¬ prime ((x-1)*(y-1))"
  by (metis assms One_nat_def Suc_diff_1 nat_neq_iff numeral_2_eq_2 prime_gt_0_nat prime_product)

lemma ex_inverse:
  assumes coprime: "coprime (e :: nat) ((P-1)*(Q-1))" 
    and "prime P" 
    and "prime Q"   
    and "P â‰  Q" 
  shows "âˆƒ d. [e*d = 1] (mod (P-1)) âˆ§ d â‰  0"
proof-
  have "coprime e (P-1)" 
    using assms(1) by simp
  then obtain d where d: "[e*d = 1] (mod (P-1))" 
    using cong_solve_coprime_nat by auto
  then show ?thesis by (metis cong_0_1_nat cong_1 mult_0_right zero_neq_one)
qed

lemma ex_k1_k2:
  assumes coprime: "coprime (e :: nat) ((P-1)*(Q-1))" 
    and "[e*d = 1] (mod (P-1))"
  shows "âˆƒ k1 k2. e*d + k1*(P-1) = 1 + k2*(P-1)"
  by (metis assms(2) cong_iff_lin_nat)

lemma ex_k_mod:
  assumes coprime: "coprime (e :: nat) ((P-1)*(Q-1))" 
    and "P â‰  Q"
    and "prime P"
    and "prime Q"
    and "d â‰  0"
    and " [e*d = 1] (mod (P-1))"
  shows "âˆƒ k. e*d = 1 + k*(P-1)"
proof-
  have "e > 0"  
    using assms(1) assms(2) prime_gt_0_nat by fastforce
  then have "e*d â‰¥ 1" using assms by simp
  then obtain k where k: "e*d = 1 + k*(P-1)" 
    using assms(6) cong_to_1'_nat by auto
  then show ?thesis
    by simp
qed

lemma fermat_little:
  assumes "prime (P :: nat)" 
  shows "[x^P = x] (mod P)" 
proof(cases "P dvd x")
  case True
  hence "x mod P = 0" by simp
  moreover have "x ^ P mod P = 0" 
    by (simp add: True assms prime_dvd_power_nat_iff prime_gt_0_nat)
  ultimately show ?thesis 
    by (simp add: cong_def)
next
  case False
  hence "[x ^ (P - 1) = 1] (mod P)" 
    using fermat_theorem assms by blast
  then show ?thesis  
    by (metis assms cong_def diff_diff_cancel diff_is_0_eq' diff_zero mod_mult_right_eq power_eq_if power_one_right prime_ge_1_nat zero_le_one)
qed

end

Theory Uniform_Sampling

section â€¹Uniform Samplingâ€º

textâ€¹Here we prove different one time pad lemmas based on uniform sampling we require throughout our proofs.â€º

theory Uniform_Sampling
  imports 
    CryptHOL.Cyclic_Group_SPMF 
    "HOL-Number_Theory.Cong"
    CryptHOL.List_Bits
begin 

text â€¹If q is a prime we can sample from the units.â€º

definition sample_uniform_units :: "nat â‡’ nat spmf"
  where "sample_uniform_units q = spmf_of_set ({..< q} - {0})"

lemma set_spmf_sampl_uni_units [simp]: "set_spmf (sample_uniform_units q) = {..< q} - {0}" 
  by(simp add: sample_uniform_units_def)

lemma lossless_sample_uniform_units: 
  assumes "q > 1"
  shows "lossless_spmf (sample_uniform_units q)"
  apply(simp add: sample_uniform_units_def) 
  using assms by auto

text â€¹General lemma for mapping using uniform sampling from units.â€º

lemma one_time_pad_units: 
  assumes inj_on: "inj_on f ({..<q} - {0})" 
    and sur: "f ` ({..<q} - {0}) = ({..<q} - {0})"  
  shows "map_spmf f (sample_uniform_units q) = (sample_uniform_units q)"
    (is "?lhs = ?rhs")
proof-
  have rhs: "?rhs = spmf_of_set (({..<q} - {0}))" 
    by(auto simp add: sample_uniform_units_def)
  also have "map_spmf(Î»s. f s) (spmf_of_set ({..<q} - {0})) = spmf_of_set ((Î»s. f s) ` ({..<q} - {0}))"
    by(simp add: inj_on)
  also have "f ` ({..<q} - {0}) = ({..<q} - {0})"
    apply(rule endo_inj_surj) by(simp, simp add: sur, simp add: inj_on)
  ultimately show ?thesis using rhs by simp
qed

text â€¹General lemma for mapping using uniform sampling.â€º

lemma one_time_pad: 
  assumes inj_on: "inj_on f {..<q}" 
    and sur: "f ` {..<q} = {..<q}"  
  shows "map_spmf f (sample_uniform q) = (sample_uniform q)"
    (is "?lhs = ?rhs")
proof-
  have rhs: "?rhs = spmf_of_set ({..< q})" 
    by(auto simp add: sample_uniform_def)
  also have "map_spmf(Î»s. f s) (spmf_of_set {..<q}) = spmf_of_set ((Î»s. f s) ` {..<q})"
    by(simp add: inj_on)
  also have "f ` {..<q} = {..<q}"
    apply(rule endo_inj_surj) by(simp, simp add: sur, simp add: inj_on)
  ultimately show ?thesis using rhs by simp
qed

text â€¹The addition map case.â€º

lemma inj_add: 
  assumes x:  "x < q" 
    and x': "x' < q" 
    and map: "((y :: nat) + x) mod q = (y + x') mod q"  
  shows "x = x'"
proof-
  have aa: "((y :: nat) + x) mod q = (y + x') mod q âŸ¹ x mod q = x' mod q"
  proof-
    have 4: "((y:: nat) + x) mod q = (y + x') mod q âŸ¹ [((y:: nat) + x) = (y + x')] (mod q)"
      by(simp add: cong_def)
    have 5: "[((y:: nat) + x) = (y + x')] (mod q) âŸ¹ [x = x'] (mod q)"
      by (simp add: cong_add_lcancel_nat)
    have 6: "[x = x'] (mod q) âŸ¹ x mod q = x' mod q"
      by(simp add: cong_def)
    then show ?thesis by(simp add: map 4 5 6)
  qed
  also have bb: "x mod q = x' mod q âŸ¹ x = x'"
    by(simp add: x x')
  ultimately show ?thesis by(simp add: map) 
qed

lemma inj_uni_samp_add: "inj_on (Î»(b :: nat). (y + b) mod q ) {..<q}"
  by(simp add: inj_on_def)(auto simp only: inj_add)

lemma surj_uni_samp: 
  assumes inj: "inj_on  (Î»(b :: nat). (y + b) mod q ) {..<q}" 
  shows "(Î»(b :: nat). (y + b) mod q) ` {..< q} =  {..< q}" 
  apply(rule endo_inj_surj) using inj by auto

lemma samp_uni_plus_one_time_pad: 
  shows "map_spmf (Î»b. (y + b) mod q) (sample_uniform q) = (sample_uniform q)"
  using inj_uni_samp_add surj_uni_samp one_time_pad by simp

text â€¹The multiplicaton map case.â€º

lemma inj_mult: 
  assumes coprime: "coprime x (q::nat)" 
    and y: "y < q" 
    and y': "y' < q" 
  and map: "x * y mod q = x * y' mod q" 
shows "y = y'"
proof-
  have "x*y mod q = x*y' mod q âŸ¹ y mod q = y' mod q"
  proof-
    have "x*y mod q = x*y' mod q âŸ¹ [x*y = x*y'] (mod q)"
      by(simp add: cong_def)
    also have "[x*y = x*y'] (mod q) = [y = y'] (mod q)"
      by(simp add: cong_mult_lcancel_nat coprime)
    also have "[y = y'] (mod q) âŸ¹ y mod q = y' mod q"
      by(simp add: cong_def)
    ultimately show ?thesis by(simp add: map)
  qed
  also have "y mod q = y' mod q âŸ¹ y = y'"
    by(simp add: y y')
  ultimately show ?thesis by(simp add: map) 
qed

lemma inj_on_mult: 
  assumes coprime: "coprime x (q::nat)" 
  shows "inj_on (Î» b. x*b mod q) {..<q}"
  apply(auto simp add: inj_on_def)
  using coprime by(simp only: inj_mult)

lemma surj_on_mult: 
  assumes coprime: "coprime x (q::nat)" 
    and inj: "inj_on (Î» b. x*b mod q) {..<q}"
  shows "(Î» b. x*b mod q) ` {..< q} = {..< q}"
  apply(rule endo_inj_surj) using coprime inj by auto

lemma mult_one_time_pad: 
  assumes coprime: "coprime x q" 
  shows "map_spmf (Î» b. x*b mod q) (sample_uniform q) = (sample_uniform q)"
  using inj_on_mult surj_on_mult one_time_pad coprime by simp

text â€¹The multiplication map for sampling from units.â€º

lemma inj_on_mult_units: 
  assumes 1: "coprime x (q::nat)" shows "inj_on (Î» b. x*b mod q) ({..<q} - {0})"
  apply(auto simp add: inj_on_def)
  using 1 by(simp only: inj_mult)

lemma surj_on_mult_units: 
  assumes coprime: "coprime x (q::nat)" 
    and inj: "inj_on (Î» b. x*b mod q) ({..<q} - {0})"
  shows "(Î» b. x*b mod q) ` ({..<q} - {0}) = ({..<q} - {0})"
proof(rule endo_inj_surj)
  show "finite ({..<q} - {0})" using coprime inj by(simp)
  show "(Î»b. x * b mod q) ` ({..<q} - {0}) âŠ† {..<q} - {0}" 
  proof -
    obtain n :: "nat set â‡’ (nat â‡’ nat) â‡’ nat set â‡’ nat" where
      "âˆ€x0 x1 x2. (âˆƒv3. v3 âˆˆ x2 âˆ§ x1 v3 âˆ‰ x0) = (n x0 x1 x2 âˆˆ x2 âˆ§ x1 (n x0 x1 x2) âˆ‰ x0)"
      by moura
    then have subset: "âˆ€N f Na. n Na f N âˆˆ N âˆ§ f (n Na f N) âˆ‰ Na âˆ¨ f ` N âŠ† Na"
      by (meson image_subsetI)
    have mem_insert: "x * n ({..<q} - {0}) (Î»n. x * n mod q) ({..<q} - {0}) mod q âˆ‰ {..<q} âˆ¨ x * n ({..<q} - {0}) (Î»n. x * n mod q) ({..<q} - {0}) mod q âˆˆ insert 0 {..<q}"
      by force
    have map_eq: "(x * n ({..<q} - {0}) (Î»n. x * n mod q) ({..<q} - {0}) mod q âˆˆ insert 0 {..<q} - {0}) = (x * n ({..<q} - {0}) (Î»n. x * n mod q) ({..<q} - {0}) mod q âˆˆ {..<q} - {0})"
      by simp
    { assume "x * n ({..<q} - {0}) (Î»n. x * n mod q) ({..<q} - {0}) mod q = x * 0 mod q"
      then have "(0 â‰¤ q) = (0 = q) âˆ¨ (n ({..<q} - {0}) (Î»n. x * n mod q) ({..<q} - {0}) âˆ‰ {..<q} âˆ¨ n ({..<q} - {0}) (Î»n. x * n mod q) ({..<q} - {0}) âˆˆ {0}) âˆ¨ n ({..<q} - {0}) (Î»n. x * n mod q) ({..<q} - {0}) âˆ‰ {..<q} - {0} âˆ¨ x * n ({..<q} - {0}) (Î»n. x * n mod q) ({..<q} - {0}) mod q âˆˆ {..<q} - {0}"
        by (metis antisym_conv1 insertCI lessThan_iff local.coprime inj_mult) }
    moreover
    { assume "0 â‰  x * n ({..<q} - {0}) (Î»n. x * n mod q) ({..<q} - {0}) mod q"
      moreover
      { assume "x * n ({..<q} - {0}) (Î»n. x * n mod q) ({..<q} - {0}) mod q âˆˆ insert 0 {..<q} âˆ§ x * n ({..<q} - {0}) (Î»n. x * n mod q) ({..<q} - {0}) mod q âˆ‰ {0}"
        then have "(Î»n. x * n mod q) ` ({..<q} - {0}) âŠ† {..<q} - {0}"
          using map_eq subset by (meson Diff_iff) }
      ultimately have "(Î»n. x * n mod q) ` ({..<q} - {0}) âŠ† {..<q} - {0} âˆ¨ (0 â‰¤ q) = (0 = q)"
        using mem_insert by (metis antisym_conv1 lessThan_iff mod_less_divisor singletonD) }
    ultimately have "(Î»n. x * n mod q) ` ({..<q} - {0}) âŠ† {..<q} - {0} âˆ¨ n ({..<q} - {0}) (Î»n. x * n mod q) ({..<q} - {0}) âˆ‰ {..<q} - {0} âˆ¨ x * n ({..<q} - {0}) (Î»n. x * n mod q) ({..<q} - {0}) mod q âˆˆ {..<q} - {0}"
      by force
    then show "(Î»n. x * n mod q) ` ({..<q} - {0}) âŠ† {..<q} - {0}"
      using subset by meson
  qed
  show "inj_on (Î»b. x * b mod q) ({..<q} - {0})" using assms by(simp) 
qed

lemma mult_one_time_pad_units: 
  assumes coprime: "coprime x q" 
  shows "map_spmf (Î» b. x*b mod q) (sample_uniform_units q) = sample_uniform_units q"
  using inj_on_mult_units surj_on_mult_units one_time_pad_units coprime by simp

text â€¹Addition and multiplication map.â€º

lemma samp_uni_add_mult: 
  assumes coprime: "coprime x (q::nat)" 
    and xa: "xa < q" 
    and ya: "ya < q" 
    and map: "(y + x * xa) mod q = (y + x * ya) mod q" 
  shows "xa = ya"
proof-
  have "(y + x * xa) mod q = (y + x * ya) mod q âŸ¹ xa mod q = ya mod q"
  proof-
    have "(y + x * xa) mod q = (y + x * ya) mod q âŸ¹ [y + x*xa = y + x *ya] (mod q)"
      using cong_def by blast
    also have "[y + x*xa = y + x *ya] (mod q) âŸ¹ [xa = ya] (mod q)"
      by(simp add: cong_add_lcancel_nat)(simp add: coprime cong_mult_lcancel_nat)
    ultimately show ?thesis by(simp add: cong_def map)
  qed
  also have "xa mod q = ya mod q âŸ¹ xa = ya"
    by(simp add: xa ya)
  ultimately show ?thesis by(simp add: map)
qed

lemma inj_on_add_mult: 
  assumes coprime: "coprime x (q::nat)" 
  shows "inj_on (Î» b. (y + x*b) mod q) {..<q}"
  apply(auto simp add: inj_on_def)
  using coprime by(simp only: samp_uni_add_mult)

lemma surj_on_add_mult: assumes coprime: "coprime x (q::nat)" and inj: "inj_on (Î» b. (y + x*b) mod q) {..<q}" 
  shows "(Î» b. (y + x*b) mod q) ` {..< q} = {..< q}" 
  apply(rule endo_inj_surj) using coprime inj by auto

lemma add_mult_one_time_pad: assumes coprime: "coprime x q" 
  shows "map_spmf (Î» b. (y + x*b) mod q) (sample_uniform q) = (sample_uniform q)"
  using inj_on_add_mult surj_on_add_mult one_time_pad coprime by simp

text â€¹Subtraction Map.â€º

lemma inj_minus: 
  assumes x: "(x :: nat) < q" 
    and ya: "ya < q" 
    and map: "(y + q - x) mod q = (y + q - ya) mod q" 
  shows  "x = ya"
proof-
  have "(y + q - x) mod q = (y + q - ya) mod q âŸ¹ x mod q = ya mod q"
  proof-
    have "(y + q - x) mod q = (y + q - ya) mod q âŸ¹ [y + q - x = y + q - ya] (mod q)"
      using cong_def by blast
    moreover have "[y + q - x = y + q - ya] (mod q) âŸ¹ [q - x = q - ya] (mod q)"
      using x ya cong_add_lcancel_nat by fastforce
    moreover have "[y + q - x = y + q - ya] (mod q) âŸ¹ [q + x = q + ya] (mod q)" 
      by (metis add_diff_inverse_nat calculation(2) cong_add_lcancel_nat cong_add_rcancel_nat cong_sym less_imp_le_nat not_le x ya)
    ultimately show ?thesis 
      by (simp add: cong_def map)
  qed
  moreover have "x mod q = ya mod q âŸ¹ x = ya"
    by(simp add: x ya)
  ultimately show ?thesis by(simp add: map)
qed

lemma inj_on_minus: "inj_on  (Î»(b :: nat). (y + (q - b)) mod q ) {..<q}"
  by(auto simp add: inj_on_def inj_minus) 

lemma surj_on_minus: 
  assumes inj: "inj_on  (Î»(b :: nat). (y + (q - b)) mod q ) {..<q}" 
  shows "(Î»(b :: nat). (y + (q - b)) mod q) ` {..< q} = {..< q}"
  apply(rule endo_inj_surj) 
  using inj by auto

lemma samp_uni_minus_one_time_pad: 
  shows "map_spmf(Î» b. (y + (q - b)) mod q) (sample_uniform q) = (sample_uniform q)"
  using inj_on_minus surj_on_minus one_time_pad by simp

lemma not_coin_flip: "map_spmf (Î» a. Â¬ a) coin_spmf = coin_spmf" 
proof-
  have "inj_on Not {True, False}" 
    by simp
  also have  "Not ` {True, False} = {True, False}" 
    by auto 
  ultimately show ?thesis using one_time_pad 
    by (simp add: UNIV_bool)
qed

lemma xor_uni_samp: "map_spmf(Î» b. y âŠ• b) (coin_spmf) = map_spmf(Î» b. b) (coin_spmf)"
  (is "?lhs = ?rhs")
proof-
  have rhs: "?rhs = spmf_of_set {True, False}"
    by (simp add: UNIV_bool insert_commute)
  also have "map_spmf(Î» b. y âŠ• b) (spmf_of_set {True, False}) = spmf_of_set((Î» b. y âŠ• b) ` {True, False})"
    by (simp add: xor_def)
  also have "(Î» b. xor y b) ` {True, False} = {True, False}"
    using xor_def by auto
  finally show ?thesis using rhs by(simp)
qed

end

Theory Semi_Honest_Def

section â€¹Semi-Honest Securityâ€º 

text â€¹We follow the security definitions for the semi honest setting as described in \cite{DBLP:books/sp/17/Lindell17}.
In the semi honest model the parties are assumed not to deviate from the protocol transcript. 
Semi honest security guarantees that no information is leaked during the running of the protocol.â€º

subsection â€¹Security definitionsâ€º

theory Semi_Honest_Def imports
  CryptHOL.CryptHOL
begin

subsubsection â€¹Security for deterministic functionalitiesâ€º

locale sim_det_def = 
  fixes R1 :: "'msg1 â‡’ 'msg2 â‡’ 'view1 spmf"
    and S1  :: "'msg1 â‡’ 'out1 â‡’ 'view1 spmf" 
    and R2 :: "'msg1 â‡’ 'msg2 â‡’ 'view2 spmf"
    and S2  :: "'msg2 â‡’ 'out2 â‡’ 'view2 spmf"
    and funct :: "'msg1 â‡’ 'msg2 â‡’ ('out1 Ã— 'out2) spmf"
    and protocol :: "'msg1 â‡’ 'msg2 â‡’ ('out1 Ã— 'out2) spmf"
  assumes lossless_R1: "lossless_spmf (R1 m1 m2)" 
    and lossless_S1: "lossless_spmf (S1 m1 out1)"
    and lossless_R2: "lossless_spmf (R2 m1 m2)" 
    and lossless_S2: "lossless_spmf (S2 m2 out2)"
    and lossless_funct: "lossless_spmf (funct m1 m2)"
begin

type_synonym 'view' adversary_det = "'view' â‡’ bool spmf"

definition "correctness m1 m2 â‰¡ (protocol m1 m2 = funct m1 m2)"

definition adv_P1 :: "'msg1 â‡’ 'msg2 â‡’ 'view1 adversary_det â‡’ real" 
  where "adv_P1 m1 m2 D â‰¡ Â¦(spmf (R1 m1 m2 â¤œ D) True) 
            - spmf (funct m1 m2 â¤œ (Î» (o1, o2). S1 m1 o1 â¤œ D)) TrueÂ¦"

definition "perfect_sec_P1 m1 m2 â‰¡ (R1 m1 m2 = funct m1 m2 â¤œ (Î» (s1, s2). S1 m1 s1))"

definition adv_P2 :: "'msg1 â‡’ 'msg2 â‡’ 'view2 adversary_det â‡’ real"
  where "adv_P2 m1 m2 D = Â¦spmf (R2 m1 m2 â¤œ (Î» view. D view)) True 
            - spmf (funct m1 m2 â¤œ (Î» (o1, o2). S2 m2 o2 â¤œ (Î» view. D view))) TrueÂ¦"

definition "perfect_sec_P2 m1 m2 â‰¡ (R2 m1 m2 = funct m1 m2 â¤œ (Î» (s1, s2). S2 m2 s2))"
 
text â€¹We also define the security games (for Party 1 and 2) used in EasyCrypt to define semi honest security for Party 1. 
We then show the two definitions are equivalent.â€º

definition P1_game_alt :: "'msg1 â‡’ 'msg2 â‡’ 'view1 adversary_det â‡’ bool spmf"
  where "P1_game_alt m1 m2 D = do {
    b â† coin_spmf;
    (out1, out2) â† funct m1 m2;
    rview :: 'view1 â† R1 m1 m2;
    sview :: 'view1 â† S1 m1 out1;
    b' â† D (if b then rview else sview);
    return_spmf (b = b')}"

definition adv_P1_game :: "'msg1 â‡’ 'msg2 â‡’ 'view1 adversary_det â‡’ real"
  where "adv_P1_game m1 m2 D = Â¦2*(spmf (P1_game_alt m1 m2 D ) True) - 1Â¦"

text â€¹We show the two definitions are equivalentâ€º

lemma equiv_defs_P1:
  assumes lossless_D: "âˆ€ view. lossless_spmf ((D:: 'view1 adversary_det) view)" 
  shows "adv_P1_game m1 m2 D = adv_P1 m1 m2 D"
  including monad_normalisation
proof-
  have return_True_not_False: "spmf (return_spmf (b)) True = spmf (return_spmf (Â¬ b)) False" 
    for b by(cases b; auto)
  have lossless_ideal: "lossless_spmf ((funct m1 m2 â¤œ (Î»(out1, out2). S1 m1 out1 â¤œ (Î»sview. D sview â¤œ (Î»b'. return_spmf (False = b'))))))"
    by(simp add: lossless_S1 lossless_funct lossless_weight_spmfD split_def lossless_D)
  have return: "spmf (funct m1 m2 â¤œ (Î»(o1, o2). S1 m1 o1 â¤œ D)) True 
                  = spmf (funct m1 m2 â¤œ (Î»(o1, o2). S1 m1 o1 â¤œ (Î» view. D view â¤œ (Î» b. return_spmf b)))) True"
    by simp
  have "2*(spmf (P1_game_alt m1 m2 D ) True) - 1 = (spmf (R1 m1 m2 â¤œ (Î»rview. D rview â¤œ (Î»(b':: bool). return_spmf (True = b'))))) True
        - (1 - (spmf (funct m1 m2 â¤œ (Î»(out1, out2). S1 m1 out1 â¤œ (Î»sview. D sview â¤œ (Î»b'. return_spmf (False = b')))))) True)"
    by(simp add: spmf_bind integral_spmf_of_set adv_P1_game_def P1_game_alt_def spmf_of_set
          UNIV_bool bind_spmf_const lossless_R1 lossless_S1 lossless_funct lossless_weight_spmfD)
   hence "adv_P1_game m1 m2 D = Â¦(spmf (R1 m1 m2 â¤œ (Î»rview. D rview â¤œ (Î»(b':: bool). return_spmf (True = b'))))) True
        - (1 - (spmf (funct m1 m2 â¤œ (Î»(out1, out2). S1 m1 out1 â¤œ (Î»sview. D sview â¤œ (Î»b'. return_spmf (False = b')))))) True)Â¦" 
     using adv_P1_game_def by simp 
    also have "Â¦(spmf (R1 m1 m2 â¤œ (Î»rview. D rview â¤œ (Î»(b':: bool). return_spmf (True = b'))))) True
                      - (1 - (spmf (funct m1 m2 â¤œ (Î»(out1, out2). S1 m1 out1 â¤œ (Î»sview. D sview 
                            â¤œ (Î»b'. return_spmf (False = b')))))) True)Â¦ = adv_P1 m1 m2 D" 
    apply(simp only: adv_P1_def spmf_False_conv_True[symmetric] lossless_ideal; simp) 
    by(simp only: return)(simp only: split_def spmf_bind return_True_not_False)
  ultimately show ?thesis by simp
qed

definition P2_game_alt :: "'msg1 â‡’ 'msg2 â‡’ 'view2 adversary_det â‡’ bool spmf"
  where "P2_game_alt m1 m2 D = do {
    b â† coin_spmf;
    (out1, out2) â† funct m1 m2;
    rview :: 'view2 â† R2 m1 m2;
    sview :: 'view2 â† S2 m2 out2;
    b' â† D (if b then rview else sview);
    return_spmf (b = b')}"

definition adv_P2_game :: "'msg1 â‡’ 'msg2 â‡’ 'view2 adversary_det â‡’ real"
  where "adv_P2_game m1 m2 D = Â¦2*(spmf (P2_game_alt m1 m2 D ) True) - 1Â¦"

lemma equiv_defs_P2:
  assumes lossless_D: "âˆ€ view. lossless_spmf ((D:: 'view2 adversary_det) view)" 
  shows "adv_P2_game m1 m2 D = adv_P2 m1 m2 D"
  including monad_normalisation
proof-
  have return_True_not_False: "spmf (return_spmf (b)) True = spmf (return_spmf (Â¬ b)) False" 
    for b by(cases b; auto)
  have lossless_ideal: "lossless_spmf ((funct m1 m2 â¤œ (Î»(out1, out2). S2 m2 out2 â¤œ (Î»sview. D sview â¤œ (Î»b'. return_spmf (False = b'))))))"
      by(simp add: lossless_S2 lossless_funct lossless_weight_spmfD split_def lossless_D)
  have return: "spmf (funct m1 m2 â¤œ (Î»(o1, o2). S2 m2 o2 â¤œ D)) True = spmf (funct m1 m2 â¤œ (Î»(o1, o2). S2 m2 o2 â¤œ (Î» view. D view â¤œ (Î» b. return_spmf b)))) True"
    by simp
  have 
    "2*(spmf (P2_game_alt m1 m2 D ) True) - 1 = (spmf (R2 m1 m2 â¤œ (Î»rview. D rview â¤œ (Î»(b':: bool). return_spmf (True = b'))))) True
        - (1 - (spmf (funct m1 m2 â¤œ (Î»(out1, out2). S2 m2 out2 â¤œ (Î»sview. D sview â¤œ (Î»b'. return_spmf (False = b')))))) True)"
    by(simp add: spmf_bind integral_spmf_of_set adv_P1_game_def P2_game_alt_def spmf_of_set 
          UNIV_bool bind_spmf_const lossless_R2 lossless_S2 lossless_funct lossless_weight_spmfD)
   hence "adv_P2_game m1 m2 D = Â¦(spmf (R2 m1 m2 â¤œ (Î»rview. D rview â¤œ (Î»(b':: bool). return_spmf (True = b'))))) True
        - (1 - (spmf (funct m1 m2 â¤œ (Î»(out1, out2). S2 m2 out2 â¤œ (Î»sview. D sview â¤œ (Î»b'. return_spmf (False = b')))))) True)Â¦"
     using adv_P2_game_def by simp 
    also have "Â¦(spmf (R2 m1 m2 â¤œ (Î»rview. D rview â¤œ (Î»(b':: bool). return_spmf (True = b'))))) True
        - (1 - (spmf (funct m1 m2 â¤œ (Î»(out1, out2). S2 m2 out2 â¤œ (Î»sview. D sview â¤œ (Î»b'. return_spmf (False = b')))))) True)Â¦ = adv_P2 m1 m2 D" 
    apply(simp only: adv_P2_def spmf_False_conv_True[symmetric] lossless_ideal; simp) 
    by(simp only: return)(simp only: split_def spmf_bind return_True_not_False)
  ultimately show ?thesis by simp
qed

end 

subsubsection â€¹ Security definitions for non deterministic functionalities â€º

locale sim_non_det_def = 
  fixes R1 :: "'msg1 â‡’ 'msg2 â‡’ ('view1 Ã— ('out1 Ã— 'out2)) spmf"
    and S1  :: "'msg1 â‡’ 'out1 â‡’ 'view1 spmf"
    and Out1 :: "'msg1 â‡’ 'msg2 â‡’ 'out1 â‡’ ('out1 Ã— 'out2) spmf" â€• â€¹takes the input of the other party so can form the outputs of partiesâ€º
    and R2 :: "'msg1 â‡’ 'msg2 â‡’ ('view2 Ã— ('out1 Ã— 'out2)) spmf"
    and S2  :: "'msg2 â‡’ 'out2 â‡’ 'view2 spmf"
    and Out2 :: "'msg2 â‡’ 'msg1 â‡’ 'out2 â‡’ ('out1 Ã— 'out2) spmf"
    and funct :: "'msg1 â‡’ 'msg2 â‡’ ('out1 Ã— 'out2) spmf"
begin

type_synonym ('view', 'out1', 'out2') adversary_non_det = "('view' Ã— ('out1' Ã— 'out2')) â‡’ bool spmf"

definition Ideal1 :: "'msg1 â‡’ 'msg2 â‡’ 'out1  â‡’ ('view1 Ã— ('out1 Ã— 'out2)) spmf"
  where "Ideal1 m1 m2 out1 = do {
    view1 :: 'view1 â† S1 m1 out1;
    out1 â† Out1 m1 m2 out1;
    return_spmf (view1, out1)}"

definition Ideal2 :: "'msg2 â‡’ 'msg1 â‡’ 'out2 â‡’ ('view2 Ã— ('out1 Ã— 'out2)) spmf"
  where "Ideal2 m2 m1 out2 = do {
    view2 :: 'view2 â† S2 m2 out2;
    out2 â† Out2 m2 m1 out2;
    return_spmf (view2, out2)}"

definition adv_P1 :: "'msg1 â‡’ 'msg2 â‡’ ('view1, 'out1, 'out2) adversary_non_det â‡’ real"
  where "adv_P1 m1 m2 D â‰¡ Â¦(spmf (R1 m1 m2 â¤œ (Î» view. D view)) True) - spmf (funct m1 m2 â¤œ (Î» (o1, o2). Ideal1 m1 m2 o1 â¤œ (Î» view. D view))) TrueÂ¦"

definition "perfect_sec_P1 m1 m2 â‰¡ (R1 m1 m2 = funct m1 m2 â¤œ (Î» (s1, s2). Ideal1 m1 m2 s1))"

definition adv_P2 :: "'msg1 â‡’ 'msg2 â‡’ ('view2, 'out1, 'out2) adversary_non_det â‡’ real"
  where "adv_P2 m1 m2 D = Â¦spmf (R2 m1 m2 â¤œ (Î» view. D view)) True - spmf (funct m1 m2 â¤œ (Î» (o1, o2). Ideal2 m2 m1 o2 â¤œ (Î» view. D view))) TrueÂ¦"

definition "perfect_sec_P2 m1 m2 â‰¡ (R2 m1 m2 = funct m1 m2 â¤œ (Î» (s1, s2). Ideal2 m2 m1 s2))"

end 

subsubsection â€¹ Secret sharing schemes â€º

locale secret_sharing_scheme = 
  fixes share :: "'input_out â‡’ ('share Ã— 'share) spmf"
    and reconstruct :: "('share Ã— 'share) â‡’ 'input_out spmf"
    and F :: "('input_out â‡’ 'input_out â‡’ 'input_out spmf) set"
begin

definition "sharing_correct input â‰¡ (share input â¤œ (Î» (s1,s2). reconstruct (s1,s2)) = return_spmf input)"

definition "correct_share_eval input1 input2 â‰¡ (âˆ€ gate_eval âˆˆ F. 
              âˆƒ gate_protocol :: ('share Ã— 'share) â‡’ ('share Ã— 'share) â‡’ ('share Ã— 'share) spmf. 
                  share input1 â¤œ (Î» (s1,s2). share input2 
                      â¤œ (Î» (s3,s4). gate_protocol (s1,s3) (s2,s4) 
                          â¤œ (Î» (S1,S2). reconstruct (S1,S2)))) = gate_eval input1 input2)"

end

end

Theory OT_Functionalities

subsection â€¹Oblivious Transfer functionalitiesâ€º 

textâ€¹Here we define the functionalities for 1-out-of-2 and 1-out-of-4 OT.â€º

theory OT_Functionalities imports
  CryptHOL.CryptHOL
begin

definition funct_OT_12 :: "('a Ã—  'a) â‡’ bool â‡’ (unit Ã— 'a) spmf"
  where "funct_OT_12 inputâ‡©1 Ïƒ = return_spmf (() , if Ïƒ then (snd inputâ‡©1) else (fst inputâ‡©1))"

lemma lossless_funct_OT_12: "lossless_spmf (funct_OT_12 msgs Ïƒ)"
  by(simp add: funct_OT_12_def)

definition funct_OT_14 :: "('a Ã— 'a Ã— 'a Ã— 'a) â‡’ (bool Ã— bool) â‡’ (unit Ã— 'a) spmf"
  where "funct_OT_14 M C = do {
    let (c0,c1) = C;
    let (m00, m01, m10, m11) = M;
    return_spmf ((),if c0 then (if c1 then m11 else m10) else (if c1 then m01 else m00))}"

lemma lossless_funct_14_OT: "lossless_spmf (funct_OT_14 M C)"
  by(simp add: funct_OT_14_def split_def)

end

Theory ETP

subsection â€¹ ETP definitions â€º

text â€¹ We define Extended Trapdoor Permutations (ETPs) following \cite{DBLP:books/sp/17/Lindell17} and \cite{DBLP:books/cu/Goldreich2004}. 
In particular we consider the property of Hard Core Predicates (HCPs). â€º

theory ETP imports
  CryptHOL.CryptHOL
begin

type_synonym ('index,'range) dist2 = "(bool Ã— 'index Ã— bool Ã— bool) â‡’ bool spmf"

type_synonym ('index,'range) advP2 = "'index â‡’ bool â‡’ bool â‡’ ('index,'range) dist2 â‡’ 'range â‡’ bool spmf"

locale etp =
  fixes I :: "('index Ã— 'trap) spmf" â€• â€¹samples index and trapdoorâ€º
    and domain :: "'index â‡’ 'range set" 
    and range :: "'index â‡’ 'range set"
    and F :: "'index â‡’ ('range â‡’ 'range)" â€• â€¹permutationâ€º
    and Fâ‡©iâ‡©nâ‡©v :: "'index â‡’ 'trap â‡’ 'range â‡’ 'range" â€• â€¹must be efficiently computableâ€º
    and B :: "'index â‡’ 'range â‡’ bool" â€• â€¹hard core predicateâ€º
  assumes dom_eq_ran: "y âˆˆ set_spmf I âŸ¶ domain (fst y) = range (fst y)"
    and finite_range: "y âˆˆ set_spmf I âŸ¶ finite (range (fst y))" 
    and non_empty_range: "y âˆˆ set_spmf I âŸ¶ range (fst y) â‰  {}" 
    and bij_betw: "y âˆˆ set_spmf I âŸ¶ bij_betw (F (fst y)) (domain (fst y)) (range (fst y))"
    and lossless_I: "lossless_spmf I"
    and F_f_inv: "y âˆˆ set_spmf I âŸ¶ x âˆˆ range (fst y) âŸ¶ Fâ‡©iâ‡©nâ‡©v (fst y) (snd y) (F (fst y) x) = x"
begin

definition S :: "'index â‡’ 'range spmf"
  where "S Î± = spmf_of_set (range Î±)"

lemma lossless_S: "y âˆˆ set_spmf I âŸ¶  lossless_spmf (S (fst y))"
  by(simp add: lossless_spmf_def S_def finite_range non_empty_range)

lemma set_spmf_S [simp]: "y âˆˆ set_spmf I âŸ¶ set_spmf (S (fst y)) = range (fst y)" 
  by (simp add: S_def finite_range)

lemma f_inj_on: "y âˆˆ set_spmf I âŸ¶ inj_on (F (fst y)) (range (fst y))" 
  by(metis bij_betw_def bij_betw dom_eq_ran bij_betw_def bij_betw dom_eq_ran) 

lemma range_f: "y âˆˆ set_spmf I âŸ¶  x âˆˆ range (fst y) âŸ¶ F (fst y) x âˆˆ range (fst y)" 
  by (metis bij_betw bij_betw dom_eq_ran bij_betwE)   

lemma f_inv_f [simp]: "y âˆˆ set_spmf I âŸ¶ x âˆˆ range (fst y) âŸ¶ Fâ‡©iâ‡©nâ‡©v (fst y) (snd y) (F (fst y) x) = x"
  by (metis bij_betw bij_betw_inv_into_left dom_eq_ran F_f_inv)

lemma f_inv_f' [simp]: "y âˆˆ set_spmf I âŸ¶ x âˆˆ range (fst y) âŸ¶ Hilbert_Choice.inv_into (range (fst y)) (F (fst y)) (F (fst y) x) = x" 
  by (metis bij_betw bij_betw_inv_into_left bij_betw dom_eq_ran)

lemma B_F_inv_rewrite: "(B Î± (Fâ‡©iâ‡©nâ‡©v Î± Ï„ yâ‡©Ïƒ') = (B Î± (Fâ‡©iâ‡©nâ‡©v Î± Ï„ yâ‡©Ïƒ') = m1)) = m1" 
  by auto

lemma uni_set_samp: 
  assumes "y âˆˆ set_spmf I"
  shows "map_spmf (Î» x. F (fst y) x) (S (fst y)) = (S (fst y))" 
(is "?lhs = ?rhs")
proof-
  have rhs: "?rhs = spmf_of_set (range (fst y))" 
    unfolding S_def by(simp)
  also have "map_spmf (Î» x. F (fst y) x) (spmf_of_set (range (fst y))) = spmf_of_set ((Î» x. F (fst y) x) ` (range (fst y)))"
    using f_inj_on assms 
    by (metis map_spmf_of_set_inj_on) 
  also have "(Î» x. F (fst y) x) ` (range (fst y)) = range (fst y)"
    apply(rule endo_inj_surj) 
    using bij_betw
      by (auto simp add: bij_betw_def dom_eq_ran f_inj_on bij_betw finite_range assms)  
  finally show ?thesis by(simp add: rhs)
qed

textâ€¹We define the security property of the hard core predicate (HCP) using a game.â€º

definition HCP_game :: "('index,'range) advP2 â‡’  bool â‡’ bool â‡’ ('index,'range) dist2 â‡’ bool spmf"
  where "HCP_game A = (Î» Ïƒ bâ‡©Ïƒ D. do {
    (Î±, Ï„) â† I;
    x â† S Î±;
    b' â† A Î± Ïƒ bâ‡©Ïƒ D x;
    let b = B Î± (Fâ‡©iâ‡©nâ‡©v Î± Ï„ x);
    return_spmf (b = b')})"

definition "HCP_adv A Ïƒ bâ‡©Ïƒ D = Â¦((spmf (HCP_game A Ïƒ bâ‡©Ïƒ D) True) - 1/2)Â¦" 

end

end

Theory ETP_OT

subsection â€¹ Oblivious transfer constructed from ETPs â€º

textâ€¹Here we construct the OT protocol based on ETPs given in \cite{DBLP:books/sp/17/Lindell17} (Chapter 4) and prove
semi honest security for both parties. We show information theoretic security for Party 1 and reduce the security of 
Party 2 to the HCP assumption.â€º

theory ETP_OT imports
  "HOL-Number_Theory.Cong"
  ETP
  OT_Functionalities
  Semi_Honest_Def
begin

type_synonym 'range viewP1 = "((bool Ã— bool) Ã— 'range Ã— 'range) spmf"
type_synonym 'range dist1 = "((bool Ã— bool) Ã— 'range Ã— 'range) â‡’ bool spmf"
type_synonym 'index viewP2 = "(bool Ã— 'index Ã— (bool Ã— bool)) spmf"
type_synonym 'index dist2 = "(bool Ã— 'index Ã— bool Ã— bool) â‡’ bool spmf"
type_synonym ('index, 'range) advP2 = "'index â‡’ bool â‡’ bool â‡’ 'index dist2 â‡’ 'range â‡’ bool spmf"

lemma if_False_True: "(if x then False else Â¬ False) âŸ· (if x then False else True)"
  by simp

lemma if_then_True [simp]: "(if b then True else x) âŸ· (Â¬ b âŸ¶ x)"
  by simp

lemma if_else_True [simp]: "(if b then x else True) âŸ· (b âŸ¶ x)"
  by simp

lemma inj_on_Not [simp]: "inj_on Not A"
  by(auto simp add: inj_on_def)

locale ETP_base = etp: etp I domain range F Fâ‡©iâ‡©nâ‡©v B
  for I :: "('index Ã— 'trap) spmf" â€• â€¹samples index and trapdoorâ€º
    and domain :: "'index â‡’ 'range set" 
    and range :: "'index â‡’ 'range set"
    and B :: "'index â‡’ 'range â‡’ bool" â€• â€¹hard core predicateâ€º
    and F :: "'index â‡’ 'range â‡’ 'range"
    and Fâ‡©iâ‡©nâ‡©v :: "'index â‡’ 'trap â‡’ 'range â‡’ 'range"
begin

textâ€¹The probabilistic program that defines the protocol.â€º

definition protocol :: "(bool Ã— bool) â‡’ bool â‡’ (unit Ã— bool) spmf"
  where "protocol inputâ‡©1 Ïƒ = do {  
    let (bâ‡©Ïƒ, bâ‡©Ïƒ') = inputâ‡©1;
    (Î± :: 'index, Ï„ :: 'trap) â† I;
    xâ‡©Ïƒ :: 'range â† etp.S Î±;
    yâ‡©Ïƒ' :: 'range â† etp.S Î±;
    let (yâ‡©Ïƒ :: 'range) = F Î± xâ‡©Ïƒ;
    let (xâ‡©Ïƒ :: 'range) = Fâ‡©iâ‡©nâ‡©v Î± Ï„ yâ‡©Ïƒ;
    let (xâ‡©Ïƒ' :: 'range) = Fâ‡©iâ‡©nâ‡©v Î± Ï„ yâ‡©Ïƒ';
    let (Î²â‡©Ïƒ :: bool) = xor (B Î± xâ‡©Ïƒ) bâ‡©Ïƒ;
    let (Î²â‡©Ïƒ' :: bool) = xor (B Î± xâ‡©Ïƒ') bâ‡©Ïƒ';
    return_spmf ((), if Ïƒ then xor (B Î± xâ‡©Ïƒ') Î²â‡©Ïƒ' else xor (B Î± xâ‡©Ïƒ) Î²â‡©Ïƒ)}"

lemma correctness: "protocol (m0,m1) c = funct_OT_12 (m0,m1) c"
proof-
  have "(B Î± (Fâ‡©iâ‡©nâ‡©v Î± Ï„ yâ‡©Ïƒ') = (B Î± (Fâ‡©iâ‡©nâ‡©v Î± Ï„ yâ‡©Ïƒ') = m1)) = m1" 
    for Î± Ï„ yâ‡©Ïƒ'  by auto
  then show ?thesis 
    by(auto simp add: protocol_def funct_OT_12_def Let_def etp.B_F_inv_rewrite bind_spmf_const etp.lossless_S local.etp.lossless_I lossless_weight_spmfD split_def cong: bind_spmf_cong)
qed

text â€¹ Party 1 views â€º

definition R1 :: "(bool Ã— bool) â‡’ bool â‡’ 'range viewP1"
  where "R1 inputâ‡©1 Ïƒ = do {
    let (bâ‡©0, bâ‡©1) = inputâ‡©1;
    (Î±, Ï„) â† I;
    xâ‡©Ïƒ â† etp.S Î±;
    yâ‡©Ïƒ' â† etp.S Î±;
    let yâ‡©Ïƒ = F Î± xâ‡©Ïƒ;
    return_spmf ((bâ‡©0, bâ‡©1), if Ïƒ then yâ‡©Ïƒ' else yâ‡©Ïƒ, if Ïƒ then yâ‡©Ïƒ else yâ‡©Ïƒ')}"

lemma lossless_R1: "lossless_spmf (R1 msgs Ïƒ)"
  by(simp add: R1_def local.etp.lossless_I split_def etp.lossless_S Let_def)

definition S1 :: "(bool Ã— bool) â‡’ unit â‡’ 'range viewP1"
  where "S1 == (Î» inputâ‡©1 (). do {
    let (bâ‡©0, bâ‡©1) = inputâ‡©1;
    (Î±, Ï„) â† I;
    yâ‡©0 :: 'range â† etp.S Î±;
    yâ‡©1 â† etp.S Î±;
    return_spmf ((bâ‡©0, bâ‡©1), yâ‡©0, yâ‡©1)})" 

lemma lossless_S1: "lossless_spmf (S1 msgs ())"
  by(simp add: S1_def local.etp.lossless_I split_def etp.lossless_S)

text â€¹ Party 2 views â€º

definition R2 :: "(bool Ã— bool) â‡’ bool â‡’ 'index viewP2"
  where "R2 msgs Ïƒ = do {
    let (b0,b1) = msgs;
    (Î±, Ï„) â† I;
    xâ‡©Ïƒ â† etp.S Î±;
    yâ‡©Ïƒ' â† etp.S Î±;
    let yâ‡©Ïƒ = F Î± xâ‡©Ïƒ;
    let xâ‡©Ïƒ = Fâ‡©iâ‡©nâ‡©v Î± Ï„ yâ‡©Ïƒ;
    let xâ‡©Ïƒ' = Fâ‡©iâ‡©nâ‡©v Î± Ï„ yâ‡©Ïƒ';
    let Î²â‡©Ïƒ = (B Î± xâ‡©Ïƒ) âŠ• (if Ïƒ then b1 else b0) ;
    let Î²â‡©Ïƒ' = (B Î± xâ‡©Ïƒ') âŠ• (if Ïƒ then b0 else b1);
    return_spmf (Ïƒ, Î±,(Î²â‡©Ïƒ, Î²â‡©Ïƒ'))}"

lemma lossless_R2: "lossless_spmf (R2 msgs Ïƒ)"
  by(simp add: R2_def split_def local.etp.lossless_I etp.lossless_S)

definition S2 :: "bool â‡’ bool â‡’ 'index viewP2"
  where "S2 Ïƒ bâ‡©Ïƒ = do {
    (Î±, Ï„) â† I;
    xâ‡©Ïƒ â† etp.S Î±;
    yâ‡©Ïƒ' â† etp.S Î±;
    let xâ‡©Ïƒ' = Fâ‡©iâ‡©nâ‡©v Î± Ï„ yâ‡©Ïƒ';
    let Î²â‡©Ïƒ = (B Î± xâ‡©Ïƒ) âŠ• bâ‡©Ïƒ;
    let Î²â‡©Ïƒ' = B Î± xâ‡©Ïƒ';
    return_spmf (Ïƒ, Î±, (Î²â‡©Ïƒ, Î²â‡©Ïƒ'))}"

lemma lossless_S2: "lossless_spmf (S2 Ïƒ bâ‡©Ïƒ)"
  by(simp add: S2_def local.etp.lossless_I etp.lossless_S split_def)

text â€¹ Security for Party 1 â€º

textâ€¹We have information theoretic security for Party 1.â€º

lemma P1_security: "R1 inputâ‡©1 Ïƒ = funct_OT_12 x y â¤œ (Î» (s1, s2). S1 inputâ‡©1 s1)" 
  including monad_normalisation
proof-
   have "R1 inputâ‡©1 Ïƒ =  do {
    let (b0,b1) = inputâ‡©1;
    (Î±, Ï„) â† I;
    yâ‡©Ïƒ' :: 'range â† etp.S Î±;
    yâ‡©Ïƒ â† map_spmf (Î» xâ‡©Ïƒ. F Î± xâ‡©Ïƒ) (etp.S Î±);
    return_spmf ((b0,b1), if Ïƒ then yâ‡©Ïƒ' else yâ‡©Ïƒ, if Ïƒ then yâ‡©Ïƒ else yâ‡©Ïƒ')}"
     by(simp add: bind_map_spmf o_def Let_def R1_def)
   also have "... = do {
    let (b0,b1) = inputâ‡©1;
    (Î±, Ï„) â† I;
    yâ‡©Ïƒ' :: 'range â† etp.S Î±;
    yâ‡©Ïƒ â† etp.S Î±;
    return_spmf ((b0,b1), if Ïƒ then yâ‡©Ïƒ' else yâ‡©Ïƒ, if Ïƒ then yâ‡©Ïƒ else yâ‡©Ïƒ')}"
     by(simp add: etp.uni_set_samp Let_def split_def cong: bind_spmf_cong)
   also have "... = funct_OT_12 x y â¤œ (Î» (s1, s2). S1 inputâ‡©1 s1)"
     by(cases Ïƒ; simp add: S1_def R1_def Let_def funct_OT_12_def)
   ultimately show ?thesis by auto
qed 

text â€¹ The adversary used in proof of security for party 2 â€º

definition ğ’œ :: "('index, 'range) advP2"
  where "ğ’œ Î± Ïƒ bâ‡©Ïƒ D2 x = do {
    Î²â‡©Ïƒ' â† coin_spmf;
    xâ‡©Ïƒ â† etp.S Î±;
    let Î²â‡©Ïƒ = (B Î± xâ‡©Ïƒ) âŠ• bâ‡©Ïƒ;
    d â† D2(Ïƒ, Î±, Î²â‡©Ïƒ, Î²â‡©Ïƒ');
    return_spmf(if d then Î²â‡©Ïƒ' else Â¬ Î²â‡©Ïƒ')}"

lemma lossless_ğ’œ: 
  assumes "âˆ€ view. lossless_spmf (D2 view)"
  shows "y âˆˆ set_spmf I âŸ¶  lossless_spmf (ğ’œ (fst y) Ïƒ bâ‡©Ïƒ D2 x)"
  by(simp add: ğ’œ_def etp.lossless_S assms)

lemma assm_bound_funct_OT_12: 
  assumes "etp.HCP_adv ğ’œ Ïƒ (if Ïƒ then b1 else b0) D â‰¤ HCP_ad"
  shows "Â¦spmf (funct_OT_12 (b0,b1) Ïƒ â¤œ (Î» (out1,out2). 
              etp.HCP_game ğ’œ Ïƒ out2 D)) True - 1/2Â¦ â‰¤ HCP_ad"
(is "?lhs â‰¤ HCP_ad")
proof-
  have "?lhs = Â¦spmf (etp.HCP_game ğ’œ Ïƒ (if Ïƒ then b1 else b0) D) True - 1/2Â¦" 
    by(simp add: funct_OT_12_def)
  thus ?thesis using assms etp.HCP_adv_def by simp
qed

lemma assm_bound_funct_OT_12_collapse: 
  assumes "âˆ€ bâ‡©Ïƒ. etp.HCP_adv ğ’œ Ïƒ bâ‡©Ïƒ D â‰¤ HCP_ad"
  shows "Â¦spmf (funct_OT_12 m1 Ïƒ â¤œ (Î» (out1,out2). etp.HCP_game ğ’œ Ïƒ out2 D)) True - 1/2Â¦ â‰¤ HCP_ad"
  using assm_bound_funct_OT_12 surj_pair assms by metis 

text â€¹ To prove security for party 2 we split the proof on the cases on party 2's input â€º

lemma R2_S2_False:
  assumes "((if Ïƒ then b0 else b1) = False)" 
  shows "spmf (R2 (b0,b1) Ïƒ â¤œ (D2 :: (bool Ã— 'index Ã— bool Ã— bool) â‡’ bool spmf)) True 
                = spmf (funct_OT_12 (b0,b1) Ïƒ â¤œ (Î» (out1,out2). S2 Ïƒ out2 â¤œ D2)) True"
proof-
  have "Ïƒ âŸ¹ Â¬ b0" using assms by simp
  moreover have "Â¬ Ïƒ âŸ¹ Â¬ b1" using assms by simp
  ultimately show ?thesis
    by(auto simp add: R2_def S2_def split_def local.etp.F_f_inv assms funct_OT_12_def cong: bind_spmf_cong_simp) 
qed

lemma R2_S2_True:
  assumes "((if Ïƒ then b0 else b1) = True)" 
    and lossless_D: "âˆ€ a. lossless_spmf (D2 a)"
  shows "Â¦(spmf (bind_spmf (R2 (b0,b1) Ïƒ) D2) True) - spmf (funct_OT_12 (b0,b1) Ïƒ â¤œ (Î» (out1, out2). S2 Ïƒ out2 â¤œ (Î» view. D2 view))) TrueÂ¦
                         = Â¦2*((spmf (etp.HCP_game ğ’œ Ïƒ (if Ïƒ then b1 else b0) D2) True) - 1/2)Â¦"
proof-
  have  "(spmf (funct_OT_12 (b0,b1) Ïƒ â¤œ (Î» (out1, out2). S2 Ïƒ out2 â¤œ D2)) True
              - spmf (bind_spmf (R2 (b0,b1) Ïƒ) D2) True) 
                    = 2 * ((spmf (etp.HCP_game ğ’œ Ïƒ (if Ïƒ then b1 else b0) D2) True) - 1/2)"
  proof-
    have  "((spmf (etp.HCP_game ğ’œ Ïƒ (if Ïƒ then b1 else b0) D2) True) - 1/2)  = 
                  1/2*(spmf (bind_spmf (S2 Ïƒ (if Ïƒ then b1 else b0)) D2) True
                        - spmf (bind_spmf (R2 (b0,b1) Ïƒ) D2) True)"
      including monad_normalisation
    proof- 
      have Ïƒ_true_b0_true: "Ïƒ âŸ¹ b0 = True" using assms(1) by simp
      have Ïƒ_false_b1_true: "Â¬ Ïƒ âŸ¹ b1" using assms(1) by simp 
      have return_True_False: "spmf (return_spmf (Â¬ d)) True = spmf (return_spmf d) False"
        for d by(cases d; simp)
      define HCP_game_true where "HCP_game_true == Î» Ïƒ bâ‡©Ïƒ. do {
    (Î±, Ï„) â† I;
    xâ‡©Ïƒ â† etp.S Î±;
    x â† (etp.S Î±);
    let Î²â‡©Ïƒ = (B Î± xâ‡©Ïƒ) âŠ• bâ‡©Ïƒ;
    let Î²â‡©Ïƒ' = B Î± (Fâ‡©iâ‡©nâ‡©v Î± Ï„ x); 
    d â† D2(Ïƒ, Î±, Î²â‡©Ïƒ, Î²â‡©Ïƒ');
    let b' = (if d then Î²â‡©Ïƒ' else Â¬ Î²â‡©Ïƒ');
    let b = B Î± (Fâ‡©iâ‡©nâ‡©v Î± Ï„ x);
    return_spmf (b = b')}"
      define HCP_game_false where "HCP_game_false == Î» Ïƒ bâ‡©Ïƒ. do {
    (Î±, Ï„) â† I;
    xâ‡©Ïƒ â† etp.S Î±;
    x â† (etp.S Î±);
    let Î²â‡©Ïƒ = (B Î± xâ‡©Ïƒ) âŠ• bâ‡©Ïƒ;
    let Î²â‡©Ïƒ' = Â¬ B Î± (Fâ‡©iâ‡©nâ‡©v Î± Ï„ x); 
    d â† D2(Ïƒ, Î±, Î²â‡©Ïƒ, Î²â‡©Ïƒ');
    let b' = (if d then Î²â‡©Ïƒ' else Â¬ Î²â‡©Ïƒ');
    let b = B Î± (Fâ‡©iâ‡©nâ‡©v Î± Ï„ x);
    return_spmf (b = b')}"
      define HCP_game_ğ’œ where "HCP_game_ğ’œ == Î» Ïƒ bâ‡©Ïƒ. do {
    Î²â‡©Ïƒ' â† coin_spmf;
    (Î±, Ï„) â† I;
    x â† etp.S Î±;
    x' â† etp.S Î±;
    d â† D2 (Ïƒ, Î±, (B Î± x) âŠ• bâ‡©Ïƒ, Î²â‡©Ïƒ');
    let b' = (if d then  Î²â‡©Ïƒ' else Â¬ Î²â‡©Ïƒ');
    return_spmf (B Î± (Fâ‡©iâ‡©nâ‡©v Î± Ï„ x') = b')}"
      define S2D where "S2D == Î» Ïƒ bâ‡©Ïƒ . do {
      (Î±, Ï„) â† I;
      xâ‡©Ïƒ â† etp.S Î±;
      yâ‡©Ïƒ' â† etp.S Î±;
      let xâ‡©Ïƒ' = Fâ‡©iâ‡©nâ‡©v Î± Ï„ yâ‡©Ïƒ';
      let Î²â‡©Ïƒ = (B Î± xâ‡©Ïƒ) âŠ• bâ‡©Ïƒ;
      let Î²â‡©Ïƒ' = B Î± xâ‡©Ïƒ';
      d :: bool â† D2(Ïƒ, Î±, Î²â‡©Ïƒ, Î²â‡©Ïƒ');
      return_spmf d}"
      define R2D where "R2D == Î» msgs Ïƒ.  do {
      let (b0,b1) = msgs;
      (Î±, Ï„) â† I;
      xâ‡©Ïƒ â† etp.S Î±;
      yâ‡©Ïƒ' â† etp.S Î±;
      let yâ‡©Ïƒ = F Î± xâ‡©Ïƒ;
      let xâ‡©Ïƒ = Fâ‡©iâ‡©nâ‡©v Î± Ï„ yâ‡©Ïƒ;
      let xâ‡©Ïƒ' = Fâ‡©iâ‡©nâ‡©v Î± Ï„ yâ‡©Ïƒ';
      let Î²â‡©Ïƒ = (B Î± xâ‡©Ïƒ) âŠ• (if Ïƒ then b1 else b0) ;
      let Î²â‡©Ïƒ' = (B Î± xâ‡©Ïƒ') âŠ• (if Ïƒ then b0 else b1);
      b :: bool â† D2(Ïƒ, Î±,(Î²â‡©Ïƒ, Î²â‡©Ïƒ'));
      return_spmf b}"
      define D_true where "D_true  == Î»Ïƒ bâ‡©Ïƒ. do {
    (Î±, Ï„) â† I;
    xâ‡©Ïƒ â† etp.S Î±;
    x â† (etp.S Î±);
    let Î²â‡©Ïƒ = (B Î± xâ‡©Ïƒ) âŠ• bâ‡©Ïƒ;
    let Î²â‡©Ïƒ' = B Î± (Fâ‡©iâ‡©nâ‡©v Î± Ï„ x);
    d :: bool â† D2(Ïƒ, Î±, Î²â‡©Ïƒ, Î²â‡©Ïƒ');
    return_spmf d}"
      define D_false where "D_false == Î» Ïƒ bâ‡©Ïƒ. do {
    (Î±, Ï„) â† I;
    xâ‡©Ïƒ â† etp.S Î±;
    x â† etp.S Î±;
    let Î²â‡©Ïƒ = (B Î± xâ‡©Ïƒ) âŠ• bâ‡©Ïƒ;
    let Î²â‡©Ïƒ' = Â¬ B Î± (Fâ‡©iâ‡©nâ‡©v Î± Ï„ x);
    d :: bool â† D2(Ïƒ, Î±, Î²â‡©Ïƒ, Î²â‡©Ïƒ');
    return_spmf d}"
      have lossless_D_false: "lossless_spmf (D_false Ïƒ (if Ïƒ then b1 else b0))"
        apply(auto simp add: D_false_def lossless_D local.etp.lossless_I) 
        using local.etp.lossless_S by auto
      have "spmf (etp.HCP_game ğ’œ Ïƒ (if Ïƒ then b1 else b0) D2) True =  spmf (HCP_game_ğ’œ Ïƒ (if Ïƒ then b1 else b0)) True" 
        apply(simp add: etp.HCP_game_def HCP_game_ğ’œ_def ğ’œ_def split_def etp.F_f_inv)
        by(rewrite bind_commute_spmf[where q = "coin_spmf"]; rewrite bind_commute_spmf[where q = "coin_spmf"]; rewrite bind_commute_spmf[where q = "coin_spmf"]; auto)+
      also have "... = spmf (bind_spmf (map_spmf Not coin_spmf) (Î»b. if b then HCP_game_true Ïƒ (if Ïƒ then b1 else b0) else HCP_game_false Ïƒ (if Ïƒ then b1 else b0))) True"
        unfolding HCP_game_ğ’œ_def HCP_game_true_def HCP_game_false_def ğ’œ_def Let_def
        apply(simp add: split_def cong: if_cong)
        supply [[simproc del: monad_normalisation]]
        apply(subst if_distrib[where f = "bind_spmf _" for f, symmetric]; simp cong: bind_spmf_cong add: if_distribR )+
        apply(rewrite in "_ = âŒ‘" bind_commute_spmf)
        apply(rewrite in "bind_spmf _ âŒ‘"  in "_ = âŒ‘" bind_commute_spmf)
        apply(rewrite in "bind_spmf _ âŒ‘" in "bind_spmf _ âŒ‘" in "_ = âŒ‘" bind_commute_spmf)
        apply(rewrite in "âŒ‘ = _" bind_commute_spmf)
        apply(rewrite in "bind_spmf _ âŒ‘" in "âŒ‘ = _" bind_commute_spmf)
        apply(rewrite in "bind_spmf _ âŒ‘" in "bind_spmf _ âŒ‘" in "âŒ‘ = _" bind_commute_spmf)
        apply(fold map_spmf_conv_bind_spmf)
        apply(rule conjI; rule impI; simp) 
         apply(simp only: spmf_bind)
         apply(rule Bochner_Integration.integral_cong[OF refl])+
         apply clarify
        subgoal for r râ‡©Ïƒ Î± Ï„ 
          apply(simp only: UNIV_bool spmf_of_set integral_spmf_of_set) 
          apply(simp cong: if_cong split del: if_split)
          apply(cases "B r (Fâ‡©iâ‡©nâ‡©v r râ‡©Ïƒ Ï„)") 
          by auto
        apply(rewrite in "_ = âŒ‘" bind_commute_spmf)
        apply(rewrite in "bind_spmf _ âŒ‘"  in "_ = âŒ‘" bind_commute_spmf)
        apply(rewrite in "bind_spmf _ âŒ‘" in "bind_spmf _ âŒ‘" in "_ = âŒ‘" bind_commute_spmf)
        apply(rewrite in "âŒ‘ = _" bind_commute_spmf)
        apply(rewrite in "bind_spmf _ âŒ‘" in "âŒ‘ = _" bind_commute_spmf)
        apply(rewrite in "bind_spmf _ âŒ‘" in "bind_spmf _ âŒ‘" in "âŒ‘ = _" bind_commute_spmf)
        apply(simp only: spmf_bind)
        apply(rule Bochner_Integration.integral_cong[OF refl])+
        apply clarify
        subgoal for r râ‡©Ïƒ Î± Ï„ 
          apply(simp only: UNIV_bool spmf_of_set integral_spmf_of_set) 
          apply(simp cong: if_cong split del: if_split)
          apply(cases " B r (Fâ‡©iâ‡©nâ‡©v r râ‡©Ïƒ Ï„)") 
          by auto
        done
      also have "... = 1/2*(spmf (HCP_game_true Ïƒ (if Ïƒ then b1 else b0)) True) + 1/2*(spmf (HCP_game_false Ïƒ (if Ïƒ then b1 else b0)) True)"
        by(simp add: spmf_bind UNIV_bool spmf_of_set integral_spmf_of_set)
      also have "... = 1/2*(spmf (D_true Ïƒ (if Ïƒ then b1 else b0)) True) + 1/2*(spmf (D_false Ïƒ (if Ïƒ then b1 else b0)) False)"   
      proof-
        have "spmf (I â¤œ (Î»(Î±, Ï„). etp.S Î± â¤œ (Î»xâ‡©Ïƒ. etp.S Î± â¤œ (Î»x. D2 (Ïƒ, Î±, B Î± xâ‡©Ïƒ = (Â¬ (if Ïƒ then b1 else b0)), Â¬ B Î± (Fâ‡©iâ‡©nâ‡©v Î± Ï„ x)) â¤œ (Î»d. return_spmf (Â¬ d)))))) True 
                = spmf (I â¤œ (Î»(Î±, Ï„). etp.S Î± â¤œ (Î»xâ‡©Ïƒ. etp.S Î± â¤œ (Î»x. D2 (Ïƒ, Î±, B Î± xâ‡©Ïƒ = (Â¬ (if Ïƒ then b1 else b0)), Â¬ B Î± (Fâ‡©iâ‡©nâ‡©v Î± Ï„ x)))))) False"
          (is "?lhs = ?rhs")
        proof-
          have "?lhs = spmf (I â¤œ (Î»(Î±, Ï„). etp.S Î± â¤œ (Î»xâ‡©Ïƒ. etp.S Î± â¤œ (Î»x. D2 (Ïƒ, Î±, B Î± xâ‡©Ïƒ = (Â¬ (if Ïƒ then b1 else b0)), Â¬ B Î± (Fâ‡©iâ‡©nâ‡©v Î± Ï„ x)) â¤œ (Î»d. return_spmf (d)))))) False"
            by(simp only: split_def return_True_False spmf_bind) 
          then show ?thesis by simp
        qed
        then show ?thesis  by(simp add: HCP_game_true_def HCP_game_false_def Let_def D_true_def D_false_def if_distrib[where f="(=) _"] cong: if_cong)   
      qed
      also have "... =  1/2*((spmf (D_true Ïƒ (if Ïƒ then b1 else b0) ) True) + (1 - spmf (D_false Ïƒ (if Ïƒ then b1 else b0) ) True))"
        by(simp add: spmf_False_conv_True lossless_D_false)
      also have "... = 1/2 + 1/2* (spmf (D_true Ïƒ (if Ïƒ then b1 else b0)) True) - 1/2*(spmf (D_false Ïƒ (if Ïƒ then b1 else b0)) True)" 
        by(simp)     
      also have "... =  1/2 + 1/2* (spmf (S2D Ïƒ (if Ïƒ then b1 else b0) ) True) - 1/2*(spmf (R2D (b0,b1) Ïƒ ) True)"
        apply(auto  simp add: local.etp.F_f_inv S2D_def R2D_def D_true_def D_false_def  assms split_def cong: bind_spmf_cong_simp)
         apply(simp add: Ïƒ_true_b0_true)
        by(simp add: Ïƒ_false_b1_true)
      ultimately show ?thesis by(simp add: S2D_def R2D_def R2_def S2_def split_def)
    qed
    then show ?thesis by(auto simp add: funct_OT_12_def)
  qed
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma P2_adv_bound:
  assumes lossless_D: "âˆ€ a. lossless_spmf (D2 a)"
  shows "Â¦(spmf (bind_spmf (R2 (b0,b1) Ïƒ) D2) True) - spmf (funct_OT_12 (b0,b1) Ïƒ â¤œ (Î» (out1, out2). S2 Ïƒ out2 â¤œ (Î» view. D2 view))) TrueÂ¦
                         â‰¤ Â¦2*((spmf (etp.HCP_game ğ’œ Ïƒ (if Ïƒ then b1 else b0) D2) True) - 1/2)Â¦"
  by(cases "(if Ïƒ then b0 else b1)"; auto simp add: R2_S2_False R2_S2_True assms)

sublocale OT_12: sim_det_def R1 S1 R2 S2 funct_OT_12 protocol 
  unfolding sim_det_def_def 
  by(simp add: lossless_R1 lossless_S1 lossless_R2 lossless_S2 funct_OT_12_def)

lemma correct: "OT_12.correctness m1 m2"
  unfolding OT_12.correctness_def  
  by (metis prod.collapse correctness)

lemma P1_security_inf_the: "OT_12.perfect_sec_P1 m1 m2" 
  unfolding OT_12.perfect_sec_P1_def using P1_security by simp 

lemma P2_security:
  assumes "âˆ€ a. lossless_spmf (D a)"
  and "âˆ€ bâ‡©Ïƒ. etp.HCP_adv ğ’œ m2 bâ‡©Ïƒ D â‰¤ HCP_ad"
  shows "OT_12.adv_P2 m1 m2 D â‰¤ 2 * HCP_ad"
proof-
  have "spmf (etp.HCP_game ğ’œ Ïƒ (if Ïƒ then b1 else b0) D) True = spmf (funct_OT_12 (b0,b1) Ïƒ â¤œ (Î» (out1, out2). etp.HCP_game ğ’œ Ïƒ out2 D)) True"
    for Ïƒ b0 b1
  by(simp add: funct_OT_12_def)
  hence "OT_12.adv_P2 m1 m2 D â‰¤ Â¦2*((spmf (funct_OT_12 m1 m2 â¤œ (Î» (out1, out2). etp.HCP_game ğ’œ m2 out2 D)) True) - 1/2)Â¦"
    unfolding OT_12.adv_P2_def using P2_adv_bound assms surj_pair prod.collapse by metis
  moreover have "Â¦2*((spmf (funct_OT_12 m1 m2 â¤œ (Î» (out1, out2). etp.HCP_game ğ’œ m2 out2 D)) True) - 1/2)Â¦ â‰¤ Â¦2*HCP_adÂ¦" 
  proof -
    have "(âˆƒr. Â¦(1::real) / rÂ¦ â‰  1 / Â¦rÂ¦) âˆ¨ 2 / Â¦1 / (spmf (funct_OT_12 m1 m2 
                â¤œ (Î»(x, y). ((Î»u b. etp.HCP_game ğ’œ m2 b D)::unit â‡’ bool â‡’ bool spmf) x y)) True - 1 / 2)Â¦ 
                      â‰¤ HCP_ad / (1 / 2)"
      using assm_bound_funct_OT_12_collapse assms by auto
    then show ?thesis
      by fastforce
  qed 
  moreover have "HCP_ad â‰¥ 0" 
    using assms(2)  local.etp.HCP_adv_def by auto
  ultimately show ?thesis by argo
qed

end

text â€¹ We also consider the asymptotic case for security proofs â€º

locale ETP_sec_para = 
  fixes I :: "nat â‡’ ('index Ã— 'trap) spmf"
    and domain ::  "'index â‡’ 'range set"
    and range ::  "'index â‡’ 'range set"
    and f :: "'index â‡’ ('range â‡’ 'range)"
    and F :: "'index â‡’ 'range â‡’ 'range"
    and Fâ‡©iâ‡©nâ‡©v :: "'index â‡’ 'trap â‡’ 'range â‡’ 'range"
    and B :: "'index â‡’ 'range â‡’ bool"
  assumes ETP_base: "â‹€ n. ETP_base (I n) domain range F Fâ‡©iâ‡©nâ‡©v"
begin

sublocale ETP_base "(I n)" domain range 
  using ETP_base  by simp

lemma correct_asym: "OT_12.correctness n m1 m2"
  by(simp add: correct)

lemma P1_sec_asym: "OT_12.perfect_sec_P1 n m1 m2"
  using P1_security_inf_the by simp                                                                

lemma P2_sec_asym: 
  assumes "âˆ€ a. lossless_spmf (D a)" 
    and HCP_adv_neg: "negligible (Î» n. etp_advantage n)"
    and etp_adv_bound: "âˆ€ bâ‡©Ïƒ n. etp.HCP_adv n ğ’œ m2 bâ‡©Ïƒ D â‰¤ etp_advantage n"
  shows "negligible (Î» n. OT_12.adv_P2 n m1 m2 D)" 
proof-
  have "negligible (Î» n. 2 * etp_advantage n)" using HCP_adv_neg 
    by (simp add: negligible_cmultI)
  moreover have "Â¦OT_12.adv_P2 n m1 m2 DÂ¦ = OT_12.adv_P2 n m1 m2 D" for n unfolding OT_12.adv_P2_def by simp
  moreover have  "OT_12.adv_P2 n m1 m2 D â‰¤ 2 * etp_advantage n" for n using assms P2_security by blast
  ultimately show ?thesis 
    using assms negligible_le HCP_adv_neg P2_security by presburger 
qed

end

end

Theory ETP_RSA_OT

subsubsection â€¹ RSA instantiation â€º

textâ€¹It is known that the RSA collection forms an ETP. Here we instantitate our proof of security for OT 
that uses a general ETP for RSA. We use the proof of the general construction of OT. The main proof effort 
here is in showing the RSA collection meets the requirements of an ETP, mainly this involves showing the 
RSA mapping is a bijection.â€º

theory ETP_RSA_OT imports
  ETP_OT
  Number_Theory_Aux
  Uniform_Sampling
begin

type_synonym index = "(nat Ã— nat)"
type_synonym trap = nat
type_synonym range = nat
type_synonym domain = nat
type_synonym viewP1 = "((bool Ã— bool) Ã— nat Ã— nat) spmf"
type_synonym viewP2 = "(bool Ã— index Ã— (bool Ã— bool)) spmf"
type_synonym dist2 = "(bool Ã— index Ã— bool Ã— bool) â‡’ bool spmf"
type_synonym advP2 = "index â‡’ bool â‡’ bool â‡’ dist2 â‡’ bool spmf"

locale rsa_base = 
  fixes prime_set :: "nat set" â€• â€¹the set of primes usedâ€º
    and B :: "index â‡’ nat â‡’ bool"
  assumes prime_set_ass: "prime_set âŠ† {x. prime x âˆ§ x > 2}"
    and finite_prime_set: "finite prime_set" 
    and prime_set_gt_2: "card prime_set > 2"
begin

lemma prime_set_non_empty: "prime_set â‰  {}" 
  using prime_set_gt_2 by auto

definition coprime_set :: "nat â‡’ nat set"
  where "coprime_set N â‰¡ {x. coprime x N âˆ§ x > 1 âˆ§ x < N}"

lemma coprime_set_non_empty: 
  assumes "N > 2" 
  shows "coprime_set N â‰  {}"
  by(simp add: coprime_set_def; metis assms(1) Suc_lessE coprime_Suc_right_nat lessI numeral_2_eq_2)

definition sample_coprime :: "nat â‡’ nat spmf"
  where "sample_coprime N = spmf_of_set (coprime_set (N))" 

lemma sample_coprime_e_gt_1:
  assumes "e âˆˆ set_spmf (sample_coprime N)"
  shows "e > 1"
  using assms by(simp add: sample_coprime_def coprime_set_def)

lemma lossless_sample_coprime: 
  assumes "Â¬ prime N" 
    and "N > 2"
  shows  "lossless_spmf (sample_coprime N)"
proof-
  have "coprime_set N â‰  {}" 
    by(simp add: coprime_set_non_empty assms) 
  also have "finite (coprime_set N)" 
    by(simp add: coprime_set_def)
  ultimately show ?thesis by(simp add: sample_coprime_def)
qed

lemma set_spmf_sample_coprime: 
  shows "set_spmf (sample_coprime N) = {x. coprime x N âˆ§ x > 1 âˆ§ x < N}"
  by(simp add: sample_coprime_def coprime_set_def)

definition sample_primes :: "nat spmf"
  where "sample_primes = spmf_of_set prime_set"

lemma lossless_sample_primes:
  shows "lossless_spmf sample_primes"
    by(simp add: sample_primes_def prime_set_non_empty finite_prime_set)

lemma set_spmf_sample_primes: 
  shows "set_spmf sample_primes âŠ† {x. prime x âˆ§ x > 2}"
  by(auto simp add: sample_primes_def prime_set_ass finite_prime_set)
  
lemma mem_samp_primes_gt_2: 
  shows "x âˆˆ set_spmf sample_primes âŸ¹ x > 2" 
  apply (simp add: finite_prime_set sample_primes_def)
  using prime_set_ass by blast

lemma mem_samp_primes_prime: 
  shows "x âˆˆ set_spmf sample_primes âŸ¹ prime x" 
  apply (simp add: finite_prime_set sample_primes_def prime_set_ass)
  using prime_set_ass by blast

definition sample_primes_excl :: "nat set â‡’ nat spmf"
  where "sample_primes_excl P = spmf_of_set (prime_set - P)"

lemma lossless_sample_primes_excl: 
  shows "lossless_spmf (sample_primes_excl {P})"
  apply(simp add: sample_primes_excl_def finite_prime_set) 
  using prime_set_gt_2 subset_singletonD by fastforce

definition sample_set_excl :: "nat set â‡’ nat set â‡’ nat spmf"
  where "sample_set_excl Q P = spmf_of_set (Q - P)"

lemma set_spmf_sample_set_excl [simp]: 
  assumes "finite (Q - P)" 
  shows "set_spmf (sample_set_excl Q P) = (Q - P)"
  unfolding  sample_set_excl_def 
  by (metis set_spmf_of_set assms)+

lemma lossless_sample_set_excl: 
  assumes "finite Q" 
    and "card Q > 2"
  shows "lossless_spmf (sample_set_excl Q {P})"
  unfolding sample_set_excl_def
  using assms subset_singletonD by fastforce

lemma mem_samp_primes_excl_gt_2: 
  shows "x âˆˆ set_spmf (sample_set_excl prime_set {y}) âŸ¹ x > 2" 
  apply(simp add: finite_prime_set sample_set_excl_def  prime_set_ass ) 
  using prime_set_ass by blast

lemma mem_samp_primes_excl_prime : 
  shows "x âˆˆ set_spmf (sample_set_excl prime_set {y}) âŸ¹ prime x" 
  apply (simp add: finite_prime_set sample_set_excl_def)
  using prime_set_ass by blast

lemma sample_coprime_lem: 
  assumes "x âˆˆ set_spmf sample_primes" 
    and " y âˆˆ set_spmf (sample_set_excl prime_set {x}) "
  shows "lossless_spmf (sample_coprime ((x - Suc 0) * (y - Suc 0)))"
proof-
  have gt_2: "x > 2" "y > 2" 
    using mem_samp_primes_gt_2 assms mem_samp_primes_excl_gt_2 by auto
  have "Â¬ prime ((x-1)*(y-1))"  
  proof-
    have "prime x" "prime y" 
      using mem_samp_primes_prime mem_samp_primes_excl_prime assms by auto
    then show ?thesis using prod_not_prime gt_2 by simp
  qed
  also have "((x-1)*(y-1)) > 2" 
    by (metis (no_types, lifting) gt_2 One_nat_def Suc_diff_1 assms(1) assms(2) calculation 
          divisors_zero less_2_cases nat_1_eq_mult_iff nat_neq_iff not_numeral_less_one numeral_2_eq_2 
              prime_gt_0_nat rsa_base.mem_samp_primes_excl_prime rsa_base.mem_samp_primes_prime rsa_base_axioms two_is_prime_nat)
  ultimately show ?thesis using lossless_sample_coprime by simp
qed    

definition I :: "(index Ã— trap) spmf"
  where "I = do {
    P â† sample_primes;  
    Q â† sample_set_excl prime_set {P};
    let N = P*Q;
    let N' = (P-1)*(Q-1);
    e â† sample_coprime N';
    let d = nat ((fst (bezw e N')) mod N');
    return_spmf ((N, e), d)}"

lemma lossless_I: "lossless_spmf I"
  by(auto simp add: I_def lossless_sample_primes lossless_sample_set_excl finite_prime_set prime_set_gt_2 Let_def sample_coprime_lem)

lemma set_spmf_I_N:
  assumes "((N,e),d) âˆˆ set_spmf I" 
  obtains P Q where "N = P * Q" 
    and "P â‰  Q"  
    and "prime P" 
    and "prime Q" 
    and "coprime e ((P - 1)*(Q - 1))" 
    and "d = nat (fst (bezw e ((P-1)*(Q-1))) mod int ((P-1)*(Q-1)))"
  using assms apply(auto simp add: I_def Let_def) 
  using finite_prime_set mem_samp_primes_prime sample_set_excl_def rsa_base_axioms sample_primes_def 
  by (simp add: set_spmf_sample_coprime)

lemma set_spmf_I_e_d: 
  assumes "((N,e),d) âˆˆ set_spmf I" 
  shows "e > 1" and "d > 1" 
  using assms sample_coprime_e_gt_1  
   apply(auto simp add: I_def Let_def) 
  by (smt Euclidean_Division.pos_mod_sign Num.of_nat_simps(5) Suc_diff_1 bezw_inverse cong_def coprime_imp_gcd_eq_1 gr0I less_1_mult less_numeral_extra(2) mem_Collect_eq mod_by_0 mod_less more_arith_simps(6) nat_0 nat_0_less_mult_iff nat_int nat_neq_iff numerals(2) of_nat_0_le_iff of_nat_1 rsa_base.mem_samp_primes_gt_2 rsa_base_axioms set_spmf_sample_coprime zero_less_diff)

definition domain :: "index â‡’ nat set"
  where "domain index â‰¡ {..< fst index}"

definition range :: "index â‡’ nat set"
  where "range index â‰¡ {..< fst index}"

lemma finite_range: "finite (range index)" 
  by(simp add: range_def)

lemma dom_eq_ran: "domain index = range index" 
  by(simp add: range_def domain_def)

definition F :: "index â‡’ (nat â‡’ nat)"
  where "F index x = x ^ (snd index) mod (fst index)"

definition Fâ‡©iâ‡©nâ‡©v :: "index â‡’ trap â‡’ nat â‡’ nat"
  where "Fâ‡©iâ‡©nâ‡©v Î± Ï„ y = y ^ Ï„ mod (fst Î±)" 

text â€¹ We must prove the RSA function is a bijection â€º

lemma rsa_bijection:
  assumes coprime: "coprime e ((P-1)*(Q-1))"
    and prime_P: "prime (P::nat)" 
    and prime_Q: "prime Q"   
    and P_neq_Q: "P â‰  Q" 
    and x_lt_pq: "x < P * Q"
    and y_lt_pd: "y < P * Q"
    and rsa_map_eq: "x ^ e mod (P * Q) = y ^ e mod (P * Q)"
  shows "x = y"
proof-
  have flt_xP: "[x ^ P = x] (mod P)" 
    using fermat_little prime_P by blast
  have flt_yP: "[y ^ P = y] (mod P)" 
    using fermat_little prime_P by blast
  have flt_xQ: "[x ^ Q = x] (mod Q)" 
    using fermat_little prime_Q by blast
  have flt_yQ: "[y ^ Q = y] (mod Q)" 
    using fermat_little prime_Q by blast
  show ?thesis 
  proof(cases "y â‰¥ x")
    case True
    hence ye_gt_xe: "y^e â‰¥ x^e"
      by (simp add: power_mono)
    have x_y_exp_e: "[x^e = y^e] (mod P)"
      using cong_modulus_mult_nat  cong_altdef_nat True ye_gt_xe cong_sym cong_def assms by blast
    obtain d where d:  "[e*d = 1] (mod (P-1)) âˆ§ d â‰  0" 
      using ex_inverse assms by blast
    then obtain k where k: "e*d = 1 + k*(P-1)" 
      using ex_k_mod assms by blast 
    hence xk_yk: "[x^(1 + k*(P-1)) = y^(1 + k*(P-1))] (mod P)" 
      by(metis k power_mult x_y_exp_e cong_pow) 
    have xk_x: "[x^(1 + k*(P-1)) = x] (mod P)" 
    proof(induct k)
      case 0
      then show ?case by simp
    next
      case (Suc k)
      assume  asm: "[x ^ (1 + k * (P - 1)) = x] (mod P)"
      then show ?case
      proof-
        have exp_rewrite: "(k * (P - 1) + P) = (1 + (k + 1) * (P - 1))" 
          by (smt add.assoc add.commute le_add_diff_inverse nat_le_linear not_add_less1 prime_P prime_gt_1_nat semiring_normalization_rules(3))
        have "[x * x ^ (k * (P - 1)) = x] (mod P)" using asm by simp
        hence "[x ^ (k * (P - 1)) * x ^ P = x] (mod P)" using flt_xP
          by (metis cong_scalar_right cong_trans mult.commute)
        hence "[x ^ (k * (P - 1) + P) = x] (mod P)"
          by (simp add: power_add)
        hence "[x ^ (1 + (k + 1) * (P - 1)) = x] (mod P)"  
          using exp_rewrite by argo
        thus ?thesis by simp
      qed
    qed 
    have yk_y: "[y^(1 + k*(P-1)) = y] (mod P)" 
    proof(induct k)
      case 0
      then show ?case by simp
    next
      case (Suc k)
      assume  asm: "[y ^ (1 + k * (P - 1)) = y] (mod P)"
      then show ?case
      proof-
        have exp_rewrite: "(k * (P - 1) + P) = (1 + (k + 1) * (P - 1))" 
          by (smt add.assoc add.commute le_add_diff_inverse nat_le_linear not_add_less1 prime_P prime_gt_1_nat semiring_normalization_rules(3))
        have "[y * y ^ (k * (P - 1)) = y] (mod P)" using asm by simp
        hence "[y ^ (k * (P - 1)) * y ^ P = y] (mod P)" using flt_yP
          by (metis cong_scalar_right cong_trans mult.commute)
        hence "[y ^ (k * (P - 1) + P) = y] (mod P)"
          by (simp add: power_add)
        hence "[y ^ (1 + (k + 1) * (P - 1)) = y] (mod P)"  
          using exp_rewrite by argo
        thus ?thesis by simp
      qed
    qed 
    have "[x^e = y^e] (mod Q)"
      by (metis rsa_map_eq cong_modulus_mult_nat cong_def mult.commute) 
    obtain d' where d':  "[e*d' = 1] (mod (Q-1)) âˆ§ d' â‰  0" 
      by (metis mult.commute ex_inverse prime_P prime_Q P_neq_Q coprime)
    then obtain k' where k': "e*d' = 1 + k'*(Q-1)" 
      by(metis ex_k_mod mult.commute prime_P prime_Q P_neq_Q coprime)
    hence xk_yk': "[x^(1 + k'*(Q-1)) = y^(1 + k'*(Q-1))] (mod Q)"
      by(metis k' power_mult â€¹[x ^ e = y ^ e] (mod Q)â€º cong_pow) 
    have xk_x': "[x^(1 + k'*(Q-1)) = x] (mod Q)" 
    proof(induct k')
      case 0
      then show ?case by simp
    next
      case (Suc k')
      assume  asm: "[x ^ (1 + k' * (Q - 1)) = x] (mod Q)"
      then show ?case
      proof-
        have exp_rewrite: "(k' * (Q - 1) + Q) = (1 + (k' + 1) * (Q - 1))" 
          by (smt add.assoc add.commute le_add_diff_inverse nat_le_linear not_add_less1 prime_Q prime_gt_1_nat semiring_normalization_rules(3))
        have "[x * x ^ (k' * (Q - 1)) = x] (mod Q)" using asm by simp
        hence "[x ^ (k' * (Q - 1)) * x ^ Q = x] (mod Q)" using flt_xQ
          by (metis cong_scalar_right cong_trans mult.commute)
        hence "[x ^ (k' * (Q - 1) + Q) = x] (mod Q)"
          by (simp add: power_add)
        hence "[x ^ (1 + (k' + 1) * (Q - 1)) = x] (mod Q)"  
          using exp_rewrite by argo
        thus ?thesis by simp
      qed
    qed 
    have yk_y': "[y^(1 + k'*(Q-1)) = y] (mod Q)" 
    proof(induct k')
      case 0
      then show ?case by simp
    next
      case (Suc k')
      assume  asm: "[y ^ (1 + k' * (Q - 1)) = y] (mod Q)"
      then show ?case
      proof-
        have exp_rewrite: "(k' * (Q - 1) + Q) = (1 + (k' + 1) * (Q - 1))" 
          by (smt add.assoc add.commute le_add_diff_inverse nat_le_linear not_add_less1 prime_Q prime_gt_1_nat semiring_normalization_rules(3))
        have "[y * y ^ (k' * (Q - 1)) = y] (mod Q)" using asm by simp
        hence "[y ^ (k' * (Q - 1)) * y ^ Q = y] (mod Q)" using flt_yQ
          by (metis cong_scalar_right cong_trans mult.commute)
        hence "[y ^ (k' * (Q - 1) + Q) = y] (mod Q)"
          by (simp add: power_add)
        hence "[y ^ (1 + (k' + 1) * (Q - 1)) = y] (mod Q)"  
          using exp_rewrite by argo
        thus ?thesis by simp
      qed
    qed 
    have P_dvd_xy: "P dvd (y - x)"
    proof-
      have "[x = y] (mod P)"
      using xk_x yk_y xk_yk 
      by (simp add: cong_def)
    thus ?thesis
      using cong_altdef_nat cong_sym True by blast
    qed
    have Q_dvd_xy: "Q dvd (y - x)"
    proof-
      have "[x = y] (mod Q)"
      using xk_x' yk_y' xk_yk'  
      by (simp add: cong_def)
    thus ?thesis
      using cong_altdef_nat cong_sym True by blast
    qed
    show ?thesis 
    proof-
    have "P*Q dvd (y - x)" using P_dvd_xy  Q_dvd_xy  
      by (simp add: assms divides_mult primes_coprime)
    then have "[x = y] (mod P*Q)" 
      by (simp add: cong_altdef_nat cong_sym True)
    hence "x mod P*Q = y mod P*Q" 
      using  cong_def xk_x xk_yk yk_y by metis 
    then show ?thesis 
      using â€¹[x = y] (mod P * Q)â€º cong_less_modulus_unique_nat x_lt_pq y_lt_pd by blast 
    qed
  next 
    case False
    hence ye_gt_xe: "x^e â‰¥ y^e" 
      by (simp add: power_mono)
    have pow_eq: "[x^e = y^e] (mod P*Q)" 
      by (simp add: cong_def assms)
    then have PQ_dvd_ye_xe: "(P*Q) dvd (x^e - y^e)" 
      using cong_altdef_nat False ye_gt_xe cong_sym by blast
    then have "[x^e = y^e] (mod P)"
      using cong_modulus_mult_nat pow_eq by blast
    obtain d where d:  "[e*d = 1] (mod (P-1)) âˆ§ d â‰  0" using ex_inverse assms
      by blast
    then obtain k where k: "e*d = 1 + k*(P-1)" using ex_k_mod assms by blast 
    have xk_yk: "[x^(1 + k*(P-1)) = y^(1 + k*(P-1))] (mod P)"
    proof-
      have "[(x^e)^d = (y^e)^d] (mod P)" 
        using â€¹[x ^ e = y ^ e] (mod P)â€º cong_pow by blast 
      then have "[x^(e*d) = y^(e*d)] (mod P)" 
        by (simp add: power_mult)
      thus ?thesis using k by simp
    qed
    have xk_x: "[x^(1 + k*(P-1)) = x] (mod P)"  
   proof(induct k)
      case 0
      then show ?case by simp
    next
      case (Suc k)
      assume  asm: "[x ^ (1 + k * (P - 1)) = x] (mod P)"
      then show ?case
      proof-
        have exp_rewrite: "(k * (P - 1) + P) = (1 + (k + 1) * (P - 1))" 
          by (smt add.assoc add.commute le_add_diff_inverse nat_le_linear not_add_less1 prime_P prime_gt_1_nat semiring_normalization_rules(3))
        have "[x * x ^ (k * (P - 1)) = x] (mod P)" using asm by simp
        hence "[x ^ (k * (P - 1)) * x ^ P = x] (mod P)" using flt_xP
          by (metis cong_scalar_right cong_trans mult.commute)
        hence "[x ^ (k * (P - 1) + P) = x] (mod P)"
          by (simp add: power_add)
        hence "[x ^ (1 + (k + 1) * (P - 1)) = x] (mod P)"  
          using exp_rewrite by argo
        thus ?thesis by simp
      qed
    qed 
    have yk_y: "[y^(1 + k*(P-1)) = y] (mod P)" 
   proof(induct k)
      case 0
      then show ?case by simp
    next
      case (Suc k)
      assume  asm: "[y ^ (1 + k * (P - 1)) = y] (mod P)"
      then show ?case
      proof-
        have exp_rewrite: "(k * (P - 1) + P) = (1 + (k + 1) * (P - 1))" 
          by (smt add.assoc add.commute le_add_diff_inverse nat_le_linear not_add_less1 prime_P prime_gt_1_nat semiring_normalization_rules(3))
        have "[y * y ^ (k * (P - 1)) = y] (mod P)" using asm by simp
        hence "[y ^ (k * (P - 1)) * y ^ P = y] (mod P)" using flt_yP
          by (metis cong_scalar_right cong_trans mult.commute)
        hence "[y ^ (k * (P - 1) + P) = y] (mod P)"
          by (simp add: power_add)
        hence "[y ^ (1 + (k + 1) * (P - 1)) = y] (mod P)"  
          using exp_rewrite by argo
        thus ?thesis by simp
      qed
    qed 
    have P_dvd_xy: "P dvd (x - y)"
    proof-
      have "[x = y] (mod P)" using xk_x yk_y xk_yk 
        by (simp add: cong_def)
      thus ?thesis 
        using cong_altdef_nat cong_sym False by simp
    qed
    have "[x^e = y^e] (mod Q)"
      using cong_modulus_mult_nat pow_eq PQ_dvd_ye_xe cong_dvd_modulus_nat dvd_triv_right by blast 
    obtain d' where d':  "[e*d' = 1] (mod (Q-1)) âˆ§ d' â‰  0" 
      by (metis mult.commute ex_inverse prime_P prime_Q coprime P_neq_Q)
    then obtain k' where k': "e*d' = 1 + k'*(Q-1)" 
      by(metis ex_k_mod mult.commute prime_P prime_Q coprime P_neq_Q)
    have xk_yk': "[x^(1 + k'*(Q-1)) = y^(1 + k'*(Q-1))] (mod Q)"
    proof-
      have "[(x^e)^d' = (y^e)^d'] (mod Q)" 
        using â€¹[x ^ e = y ^ e] (mod Q)â€º cong_pow by blast 
      then have "[x^(e*d') = y^(e*d')] (mod Q)" 
        by (simp add: power_mult)
      thus ?thesis using k'
        by simp
    qed
    have xk_x': "[x^(1 + k'*(Q-1)) = x] (mod Q)"  
   proof(induct k')
      case 0
      then show ?case by simp
    next
      case (Suc k')
      assume  asm: "[x ^ (1 + k' * (Q - 1)) = x] (mod Q)"
      then show ?case
      proof-
        have exp_rewrite: "(k' * (Q - 1) + Q) = (1 + (k' + 1) * (Q - 1))" 
          by (smt add.assoc add.commute le_add_diff_inverse nat_le_linear not_add_less1 prime_Q prime_gt_1_nat semiring_normalization_rules(3))
        have "[x * x ^ (k' * (Q - 1)) = x] (mod Q)" using asm by simp
        hence "[x ^ (k' * (Q - 1)) * x ^ Q = x] (mod Q)" using flt_xQ
          by (metis cong_scalar_right cong_trans mult.commute)
        hence "[x ^ (k' * (Q - 1) + Q) = x] (mod Q)"
          by (simp add: power_add)
        hence "[x ^ (1 + (k' + 1) * (Q - 1)) = x] (mod Q)"  
          using exp_rewrite by argo
        thus ?thesis by simp
      qed
    qed 
    have yk_y': "[y^(1 + k'*(Q-1)) = y] (mod Q)" 
    proof(induct k')
      case 0
      then show ?case by simp
    next
      case (Suc k')
      assume  asm: "[y ^ (1 + k' * (Q - 1)) = y] (mod Q)"
      then show ?case
      proof-
        have exp_rewrite: "(k' * (Q - 1) + Q) = (1 + (k' + 1) * (Q - 1))" 
          by (smt add.assoc add.commute le_add_diff_inverse nat_le_linear not_add_less1 prime_Q prime_gt_1_nat semiring_normalization_rules(3))
        have "[y * y ^ (k' * (Q - 1)) = y] (mod Q)" using asm by simp
        hence "[y ^ (k' * (Q - 1)) * y ^ Q = y] (mod Q)" using flt_yQ
          by (metis cong_scalar_right cong_trans mult.commute)
        hence "[y ^ (k' * (Q - 1) + Q) = y] (mod Q)"
          by (simp add: power_add)
        hence "[y ^ (1 + (k' + 1) * (Q - 1)) = y] (mod Q)"  
          using exp_rewrite by argo
        thus ?thesis by simp
      qed
    qed 
    have Q_dvd_xy: "Q dvd (x - y)"
    proof-
      have "[x = y] (mod Q)" 
        using xk_x' yk_y' xk_yk' by (simp add: cong_def)
      thus ?thesis
        using cong_altdef_nat cong_sym False by simp
    qed
    show ?thesis
    proof-
      have "P*Q dvd (x - y)" 
        using P_dvd_xy Q_dvd_xy by (simp add: assms divides_mult primes_coprime)
      hence 1: "[x = y] (mod P*Q)" 
        using False cong_altdef_nat linear by blast
      hence "x mod P*Q = y mod P*Q" 
        using cong_less_modulus_unique_nat x_lt_pq y_lt_pd by blast 
      thus ?thesis 
        using 1 cong_less_modulus_unique_nat x_lt_pq y_lt_pd by blast
    qed
  qed
qed

lemma rsa_bij_betw:
  assumes "coprime e ((P - 1)*(Q - 1))"
    and "prime P" 
    and "prime Q"   
    and "P â‰  Q"
  shows "bij_betw (F ((P * Q), e)) (range ((P * Q), e)) (range ((P * Q), e))"
proof-
  have PQ_not_0: "prime P âŸ¶ prime Q âŸ¶ P * Q â‰  0"
  using assms by auto
  have "inj_on (Î»x. x ^ snd (P * Q, e) mod fst (P * Q, e)) {..<fst (P * Q, e)}"
    apply(simp add: inj_on_def) 
    using rsa_bijection assms by blast
  moreover have "(Î»x. x ^ snd (P * Q, e) mod fst (P * Q, e)) ` {..<fst (P * Q, e)} = {..<fst (P * Q, e)}"
    apply(simp add: assms(2) assms(3) prime_gt_0_nat PQ_not_0)
    apply(rule endo_inj_surj; auto simp add: assms(2) assms(3) image_subsetI prime_gt_0_nat PQ_not_0 inj_on_def) 
    using rsa_bijection assms by blast
  ultimately show ?thesis 
  unfolding bij_betw_def F_def range_def by blast
qed

lemma bij_betw1:
  assumes "((N,e),d) âˆˆ set_spmf I" 
  shows "bij_betw (F ((N), e)) (range ((N), e)) (range ((N), e))"
proof-
  obtain P Q where "N = P * Q" and "bij_betw (F ((P*Q), e)) (range ((P*Q), e)) (range ((P*Q), e))"
  proof-
    obtain P Q where "prime P" and "prime Q" and "N = P * Q" and "P â‰  Q" and "coprime e ((P - 1)*(Q - 1))"
      using set_spmf_I_N assms by blast
    then show ?thesis
      using rsa_bij_betw that by blast
  qed
  thus ?thesis by blast 
qed

lemma 
  assumes "P dvd x"
shows "[x = 0] (mod P)"
  using assms cong_def by force

lemma rsa_inv: 
  assumes d: "d = nat (fst (bezw e ((P-1)*(Q-1))) mod int ((P-1)*(Q-1)))"
    and coprime: "coprime e ((P-1)*(Q-1))"
    and prime_P: "prime (P::nat)" 
    and prime_Q: "prime Q"   
    and P_neq_Q: "P â‰  Q" 
    and e_gt_1: "e > 1"
    and d_gt_1: "d > 1" 
  shows "((((x) ^ e) mod (P*Q)) ^ d) mod (P*Q) = x mod (P*Q)"
proof(cases "x = 0 âˆ¨ x = 1")
  case True
  then show ?thesis 
    by (metis assms(6) assms(7) le_simps(1) nat_power_eq_Suc_0_iff neq0_conv not_one_le_zero numeral_nat(7) power_eq_0_iff power_mod)
next
  case False
  hence x_gt_1: "x > 1" by simp
  define z where "z = (x ^ e) ^ d - x"
  hence z_gt_0: "z > 0"
  proof-
    have "(x ^ e) ^ d - x = x ^ (e * d) - x"
      by (simp add: power_mult)
    also have "... > 0" 
      by (metis x_gt_1 e_gt_1 d_gt_1 le_neq_implies_less less_one linorder_not_less n_less_m_mult_n not_less_zero numeral_nat(7) power_increasing_iff power_one_right zero_less_diff) 
    ultimately  show ?thesis using z_def by argo
  qed
  hence "[z = 0] (mod P)" 
  proof(cases "[x = 0] (mod P)")
    case True
    then show ?thesis 
    proof -
      have "0 â‰  d * e"
        by (metis (no_types) assms assms mult_is_0 not_one_less_zero)
      then show ?thesis
        by (metis (no_types) Groups.add_ac(2) True add_diff_inverse_nat cong_def cong_dvd_iff cong_mult_self_right dvd_0_right dvd_def dvd_trans mod_add_self2 more_arith_simps(5) nat_diff_split power_eq_if power_mult semiring_normalization_rules(7) z_def)
    qed
  next
    case False
    have "[e * d = 1] (mod ((P - 1) * (Q - 1)))" 
      by (metis d bezw_inverse coprime coprime_imp_gcd_eq_1 nat_int)
    hence "[e * d = 1] (mod (P - 1))" 
      using assms cong_modulus_mult_nat by blast
    then obtain k where k: "e*d = 1 + k*(P-1)" 
      using ex_k_mod assms by force
    hence "x ^ (e * d) = x * ((x ^ (P - 1)) ^ k)" 
      by (metis power_add power_one_right mult.commute power_mult)
    hence "[x ^ (e * d) = x * ((x ^ (P - 1)) ^ k)] (mod P)" 
      using cong_def by simp
    moreover have "[x ^ (P - 1) = 1] (mod P)"
        using prime_P fermat_theorem False
        by (simp add: cong_0_iff)
    moreover have "[x ^ (e * d) = x * ((1) ^ k)] (mod P)"
      by (metis â€¹x ^ (e * d) = x * (x ^ (P - 1)) ^ kâ€º calculation(2) cong_pow cong_scalar_left)
    hence "[x ^ (e * d) = x] (mod P)" by simp
    thus ?thesis using z_def z_gt_0 
      by (simp add: cong_diff_iff_cong_0_nat power_mult)
  qed
  moreover have "[z = 0] (mod Q)" 
  proof(cases "[x = 0] (mod Q)")
    case True
    then show ?thesis 
    proof -
      have "0 â‰  d * e"
        by (metis (no_types) assms mult_is_0 not_one_less_zero)
      then show ?thesis
        by (metis (no_types) Groups.add_ac(2) True add_diff_inverse_nat cong_def cong_dvd_iff cong_mult_self_right dvd_0_right dvd_def dvd_trans mod_add_self2 more_arith_simps(5) nat_diff_split power_eq_if power_mult semiring_normalization_rules(7) z_def)
    qed
  next
    case False
    have "[e * d = 1] (mod ((P - 1) * (Q - 1)))" 
      by (metis d bezw_inverse coprime coprime_imp_gcd_eq_1 nat_int)
    hence "[e * d = 1] (mod (Q - 1))" 
      using assms cong_modulus_mult_nat mult.commute by metis
    then obtain k where k: "e*d = 1 + k*(Q-1)" 
      using ex_k_mod assms by force
    hence "x ^ (e * d) = x * ((x ^ (Q - 1)) ^ k)" 
      by (metis power_add power_one_right mult.commute power_mult)
    hence "[x ^ (e * d) = x * ((x ^ (Q - 1)) ^ k)] (mod P)" 
      using cong_def by simp
    moreover have "[x ^ (Q - 1) = 1] (mod Q)"
        using prime_Q fermat_theorem False
        by (simp add: cong_0_iff)
    moreover have "[x ^ (e * d) = x * ((1) ^ k)] (mod Q)"
      by (metis â€¹x ^ (e * d) = x * (x ^ (Q - 1)) ^ kâ€º calculation(2) cong_pow cong_scalar_left)
    hence "[x ^ (e * d) = x] (mod Q)" by simp
    thus ?thesis using z_def z_gt_0 
      by (simp add: cong_diff_iff_cong_0_nat power_mult)
  qed
  ultimately have "Q dvd (x ^ e) ^ d - x"
                  "P dvd (x ^ e) ^ d - x" 
    using z_def assms cong_0_iff by blast +
  hence "P * Q dvd ((x ^ e) ^ d - x)" 
    using assms divides_mult primes_coprime_nat by blast
  hence "[(x ^ e) ^ d = x] (mod (P * Q))"
    using z_gt_0 cong_altdef_nat z_def by auto
  thus ?thesis 
    by (simp add: cong_def power_mod)
qed
